0.description: Very ungrateful employees i never felt so humiliated in my life! This place is horrible and so is the employees that work there! I was not alloed to enter the store because my daughter has a quarter size bite in her hand that she was about to put in her mouth. My daughter is under treatment and she needs something to settle her stomach! I am never shopping gere again!I understand no food is allowed but that to me is a soda can open chips a burger in there hand not a 4 year with a bite in there hand! They deserve no star

3.description: Great Ice Cream

1.description: What a dissapointment. I had been bringing my family here since 2003. We went on Sunday,   Aug. 9th at 7:30pm. They had 6 ladies and a guy working. Was not that busy. Not only are they aloof with their customers but they are very lethargic when taking your order. They  need someone to help them with a better system so they are not so  disorganized taking orders. The paletas are not as good quality as before. They do have great paletas, however... with so much competition now, and their horrible customer service at this location,  I don't mind taking my family of 6 to have paletas elsewhere. All 6 ladies working there were in a circle chatting and chewing on something. They completely ignored us. Wow. I thought they needed customers to stay in business. I guess they don't need anymore customers.Same paletas  if not better ones with much better customer service are found on by 3320 W. 55th St south of here. I don't know, maybe we went on a bad day?

2.description: While it was sad I wasn't able to make the 9/6/08 south side chicken 'n waffles yelp event, I did the next best thing, once I broke outta my sleep: Made a trip to a south side place I'd vowed to make it to at some point. Tropicana was exactly that place I've had in mind for awhile to go to, after browsing around reviews on the south and southwest side.They had a decent variety of flavors, give or take around two dozen, but I taken aback a little by surprise that they didn't allow samples of any of their ice creams. In addition, I thought there should've been some kind of signage on the glass side of the cooler holding the ice creams, as to where each flavor was. Regardless, I got a 2-scoop cone of both mango and pistachio ice cream. The pistachio ice cream was amazing, and possibly may now be my new favorite pistachio ice cream anywhere. Mango was pretty decent, too.I finished off my trip here by getting a watermelon fruit bar. Wasn't bad, but didn't like the fact there were a lotta seeds in it. At least I know next time to ask the staff beforehand which of their fruit bars does not have seeds in it. Thought it was interesting too that in addition to selling nachos and cheese, you could actually get Cheetos and cheese here for $1.25! (though I doubt I'll get that anytime soon)Price-wise, this place had excellent value for the things they sold. Both things I got were $5.34(after tax) in total, but ordered both separately to savor my experience here. The 2-scoop cone was only $3.91, and the fruit bar was just $1.43! The credit card minimum is $10(the sign that said this didn't list which credit cards they accept), based on a sign I saw, and in case anyone drives here, parking didn't seem too difficult to find on Kedzie. Absolutely hope to return here very soon!

5.description: I used to love going to this place. My favorite ice cream bar was the *Fresa con Crema* Strawberry with Cream. The ice cream is good but one day, about a month ago from now, I walked in about 7 P.M when was  pretty busy. I was disgusted by how the place looked. There are benches you can sit on, but the ones that were free were very dirty. The floor also was very dirty and there was stains. It was gross. If they cannot have some one come out and clean the place, I don't want to imagine how the kitchen looks!!! If they were clean I would give them a 4 but a dirty ice cream place or anywhere in general is horrible!

6.description: came here a few times, every time busy, everytime pretty clean. im pretty sure the kitchen isnt dirty, what im sure of is that the ice cream here is great!!! they have many different flavors to pick from, i would make a trip just for the ice cream here, but i dont really need to since im not too far from the location.

0.description: My favorite ice cream shop in Chicago. The location is unexpected for anyone who's not really super familiar with the south side, which makes it a fun "out of the way" place to take someone on a date. For the last 10 years this place has been my favorite little secret, especially when I was living nearby and could take the 55th street bus right to it.The flavors are posted in Spanish only, and sometimes the person at the counter doesn't really speak English. Be ready with at least a little Spanish when you order, just in case.My personal favorites are the one made with crushed pecans (nuez), the prune one that has a prune right on the stick (ciruela pasa?), and the one filled with sweet goat's milk caramel (cajeta). Some of the flavors are salty and can be very spicy (mango con chile for example), so don't get those if that's not the kind of experience you're looking for. All of the fruit flavors are made with fresh fruit and are delicious.I've heard good things about the place down the street, "Tacos Villa", but haven't tried it yet. So maybe I'll stop by Tropicana again in the next couple of days...Oh, one more hot tip: the parking right outside the place is "a rush hour no parking" zone, so don't park there from 4 to 6. I came on a holiday one time and parked there and got a ticket anyway, even though it doesn't seem like holidays should be covered by the rush hour parking laws. It doesn't matter how good a paleta is if it costs $50!

4.description: Delicious Mexican ice cream and paletas (ice cream bars) in an astonishing variety of flavors anywhere from vanilla (with or without raisins) to tequila! They have flavors such as guava, coffee, cucumber, chocolate chip, pina colada, cactus pear, cajeta (dulce de leche), coconut, watermelon, gum, mango, etc. They make all of their ice cream there and use mostly natural ingredients. Besides ice cream, they also have nachos, chicharrones, strawberries and cream, drinks, shakes, and corn. Service is fast but if you go on a Sunday afternoon or on very hot days, the line is all the way out on the street!

3.description: This is a legit fastfood burger joint. Everything is made after you order, so its all warm. You can tell they kinda cut corners with ingredients, but if you want food its your best bet over McDonalds. Burgers and sandwiches come with fries. I've really only had their burger, gyro, and Italian beef.Staff is meh. They greet you, take your order, then ignore you till the food is done.

1.description: This place was decent a year ago or so ago, before they started screwing up orders. The food isn't bad, but all I'm going to say is, if you decide to order from here, be sure to double check your food before you leave.

2.description: I've ordered several times from this place and not one complaint from me yet. Everytime I have gotten something different so I don't get stuck on one thing. Recently I got the steak fries minus the cheese which I don't like and O couldn't stop eating them. Personally I would of prefer the fries to be thicker like before but I still enjoyed them regardless. My husband likes the torta al pastor. My fave has been the burger... Will continue to go back to this place.

0.description: Good food. Greasy spoon quality. Only have one complaint. It was just about what I was told by the cashier one day and has stuck with me ever since. It went a little something like this,Me: I love this place because it's close to me job so I can walk here for lunch. Plus, there aren't many of these kind of places around here. Please don't ever leave guys lolCashier: (Being friendly) Yeah the only other fast food places like this are a little farther south. But that's by all the black people so you never know what could happen there. So, we definitely have this area wrapped up because people are too scared to go by the blacks for this food lolMe: *Awkward weird half smile/ half mouth just hanging open a bit* I turn to my coworker who happens to be white and she said she couldn't believe what she said either. Now I myself am Black. I'm light skinned and constantly get confused for Puerto Rican or Dominican, especially in this area which is predominantly Hispanic/Latino.Maybe she didn't realize who she was talking to but that's besides the point. It was racist, and rude. And because of that reason, I can't give this place the complete 5 stars it deserves for the quality of it's food. An employee can represent the company it works for, With that in mind, one can ASSUME this is how everybody in there thinks......

4.description: I shouldn't have done it.Pros:Open lateWiFitakes creditCoke in a glass bottleCons:the foodThey serve everything from Italian beefs, to 5 packs of hot dogs, tacos, burritos, wings, etc. To their credit the place seems very clean with bright signs and plenty of security cameras.Stopped by for some late night eats, ordered a chicken burrito which didn't taste very good at all. The flour tortilla tasted very processed, the chicken tasted frozen and processed. Anyone who frequents fast food knows that none of this should be a surprise but the appeal of fast food is that something should make up for the fact that you know it's bad for you (like the taste, the place, etc.). The taste of Big Al's food made it quite obvious I was wrecking my body. Hopefully it will improve one day.I didn't know the burrito came with fries. Those were 'meh.'

3.description: Waiting to drop off a prescription while the staff gossips at the pharmacy counter the line almost to the door and this people taking their sweet time

1.description: This place is always packed 24/7. Ever since they remodeled it, it seems like they acquired more customers. They even tore down 2 houses to make a larger parking lot. There's always a line in the photo section, in the front registers, and even in the pharmacy, ALWAYS! it's frustrating having to wait so long to check out and there's usually only 2 registers open.

2.description: Great place open 24/7 wgich is great but the place gets really packed but the ppl work hard and as fast as they can

5.description: Located on a busy intersection, this Walgreen's has a medium sized private parking lot, with lots of business!  Come nightfall, it looks a nightclub as cars circle around waiting for you to pull out and leave, they literally need valet parking at this location.Aside from the scandalous parking situation, this Walgreens is normal, safe like any old Walgreens.

6.description: I give credit to the people who handle the check out counters and the workers as a whole with one major exception.The pharmacy!Perhaps the slowest laziest and most careless pharmacy on the south side!! Simply put they take forever to fill a prescription and to make matters worse (according to some people I know who frequent this place) the pharmacists sometime say " oh It will be ready tomorrow" but nope they flat out ignore that promise and instead you have to wait another day! Just to pick up your medicine and in some cases they may give you the wrong medicine!I advise anyone who lives in the Gage Park neighborhood or anyone around the area to steer clear of this Walgreen's if you are in need of a prescription to fill. However stop buy if you want chips, deodorant, or condoms but nothing else.My two cents and hey if service improves (hey i got sources) I may change my review but until then stay away.ps yes the parking sucks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

0.description: I love this place. It is open 24/7 so if you need them, they are open. They just remodeled the store completely and it looks better and cleaner than ever. It is surprising the items you will find in this Walgreens: Fresh fruit, even sandwiches for the after the bar midnight munchies. There are not too many places open 24 in this neighborhood. The service is really fast and professional, I have not needed the actual pharmacy and I hope I  never do. But the employees on the store side are nice and fast. And yes, the parking can get a little crazy, but with a little bit of patience and help from street parking, you will always manage to get in, get what you need and go. They have good service and are open 24/7.

4.description: Alright location but I wish the pharmacy would work a bit faster here.

1.description: I like shopping here because its right the street from my house. Its fairly priced and well presented. On the weekends they have awesome carnitas.

0.description: Carnitas & menudo on the weekends are great! Always come here to shop for poultry & meats

I'm only giving it 2 stars because they sell lottery tickets and scratch cards. I don't have to wait in long lines at 7-11 or so when I'm on a mission to win the mega billions lotto.Their is nothing supermercado about this place. Its really crappy inside and its pretty ghetto. Items/products were not faced, small bag of peanuts were $4. The store has graffiti by the entrance and there are so many signs and labels everywhere its like wtf! There's been times where I have been there while the sun is still out, but this last time, you have to get buzzed in otherwise you'll be locked out of the store.

3.description: Well, it's not as fun as going to the former Maxwell Street location, which somehow made the food taste better in comparison with the surroundings, but on the other hand, if you close your eyes, the smell of fried onions and pork chop sandwiches help you imagine huge piles of junk for sale. Do you need a pork chop sandwich in the middle of the night (or any other time of day)? This is your place! Beware: they don't take the bones out.

1.description: A-Ok! I LOVE THIS PLACE! I only come here usually at night or at O-Dark thirty just shit faced hammered. I try my hardest to turn this place into a wannabe Weiner circle. I talk mad stuff to the guys in the back and most times they bite and start talking trash back. I don't take this place serious at all and let me tell you, at that time of the night walking in shwasted, I get my food and it serves its purpose. Mitigates morning hangovers to a minimum and sometimes no hangover at all! Thank you for always being there for me no matter what time of the night.

2.description: Been here a couple of times. The food is old as if it has been sitting there for a while and the onions are watery. They also only take cash. So not worth the trouble.

0.description: 10/10 experience, hands down. Best hotdogs I've ever had in my life. Great pizza puff, amazing grilled onions & fries, good prices & cool staff. Chicago's Best!

1.description: This place is decent, food is great and prices are lower compared to some other places in the area. Cash only so be prepared.

0.description: Good tacos ,salsa was good too. Tacos are made quickly, and no skimping on quality! These are the authentic Mexican tacos, just like if your at the best stands/"puestos" in Mexico. Al pastor and asada tacos were awesome! The adults loved it and the kids did as well!

All the pastries are so incredibly cheap! The pastries range from 15 to 75 CENTS! And the people are so sweet, and everything is incredibly fresh, even at the end of the day. And so many options for such a low-key store: croissants, madeleines, donuts, Danishes, cinnamon rolls, frosted or unfrosted, cookies, cakes, and the list goes on.I had the round sweet bun, and it was delicious, not too rich with subtle flavors. Also there are corn flour options for the gluten free!

3.description: Great food. what can I say! The bread, soups and vegetables are fresh everyday.

1.description: Horrible customer service!  I watched a lady return food with a bug literally fried into her food and the manager was completely dismissive of her, then he refused to return refund her!?  Another employee made a disrespectful comment to her on the way out.  I will not be back and I'm disappointed that this situation wasn't handled in a professional manner.

2.description: This place used to be good a handful of years back (14) when I was a little kid. Now the ladies that make the food just smack whatever meat they want into your sub. I understand that English isn't their first language, but they need proper training. I just recently moved close by and every time I have gone, my order gets messed up and I don't realize until I get home and I'm not the type of person to go back and make a complaint but I would let them know the following time I went. I will no longer go because they do not have a clue as to what they're doing. The only reason it has two stars is because 1) for the nostalgia I get 2) and because whenever I do get my order correct, it can be a good sub. Prices are ok but if you pay more for something that is meant to be less then it isn't ok. If you do go, make sure to  watch what they're putting in and correct them asap.

9.description: This is my favorite sub place! Its a knock-off of Mr. Submarine Port but blows them out of the water!You 3 size sandwiches to choose from, hot or cold. I usually get the regular turkey, heated. Sandwich comes with shredded lettuce, tomatoes, onions & melted cheese. And do not forget their homemade soups! They usually have the Cream of Chicken & Rice on Saturdays and it is the best! It always makes me feel better when I'm under the weather.Another plus: they are open SUPER late, like 4 in the morning. Best place to visit after a night of drinking.

10.description: Good stuff. You don't need subway when you got this place. The subs are solid. Nothing out of this world, but it sure beats subway.

4.description: Apparently this is the submarine pier now? Same food and vendors though, so it's cool. Great subs, soups of the day made from scratch. I've been coming here since I moved to Gage in 97 and it's always been consistent!

6.description: It's a simple submarine sandwich shop, they have a soup of the day, like 14 different subs, salads and ice cream The place is cash only - but well worth the trip to the ATM.

12.description: if around the area, and  thinking about subway forget it, come here. this is another place ive been going to for a while, the subs are great (i usually get the chicken breast). the meats are always fresh and tasty, its very clean in here. i would recommend if in the area, the owner has changed over the years, but the taste hasnt.   .

5.description: Nice kids working in here. None of the types that will spit in your sandwich. Fresh ingredients great sandwiches at a fair price.

11.description: Submarine Port is a nice alternative to your typical footlong. It's a local joint that you would probably never think of going to. They stay open really late on the weekends for those craving a nice sub at 2-3 a.m. The place is really clean and the meats taste fresh too. A king size sub should do the job for the normal appetite, I recommend the King Port.

8.description: Food is OK, service is very poor, only take cash. The End

0.description: Love this place since I was little! Worth it for the sketch neighborhood. Sandwiches are so good! And I believe it's only Cash only :)

7.description: My favorite sub place ...I recommend the corn beef sandwich and garlic fries ... What's in that seasoning ....phenomenal ....employees r sweet hearts ... Old school quality food and service... A must try

3.description: Went in a few years ago for a manicure. The guy painted all 10 of my nails halfway. Someone else had to remove the polish and re-do them. Returned with my mother (I don't know why she goes here...) I asked for gel overlay. She used acrylic. I didn't really mind but they are charging for something they aren't doing. I try not to be fussy, but this place takes no pride in what they do. I had to ask her over and over to fix things on my nails and I just got tired of it. Wish I would give 0 stars.

1.description: I have been going to this place for years and never have I had to complain until today I am not going to be considerate about this topic if I go to a nail salon its to get my nails for many women this is there alone time and by that I mean " no freakin children" it's probably the only 2 hours we get to ourselves I have 4 kids and if in planning to go and get a service done at a beauty salon or nail salon I'm not taking my kids 1 because it's me time 2 I M considerate to the other people there today there were 2 woman with the same child getting a pedi and nails done this little monster was all over the place like it was there house toys , food , and baby bottles everywhere wtf he's running all over distracting the workers and keeping me from getting my shit done and these 2 stupid ass woman on the phone instead of watching that little monster while he is sticking his cell phone inside the uv light and all she could say no Lorenzo don't do that like he gave a shit Ladies keep your freakin children at home it's a nail salon not a freakin Daycare !!!

2.description: Ive been getting my nails done here for a while and ilove the service. Havent had anything bad done yet and ihope it stays like that.

0.description: I have been going to this place for years and it is the best place!!!!! And let me tell you, I am picky. Even though I moved, I could not find a place that clean my nails so well. I recommend the young girls there,  they do a great job and very nice designs!.  The only thing is they need to work in their customer service skills but other than that,  a very happy customer.

4.description: I work nearby and stepped in here one day and they did a great job on my American manicure and I got hooked.  However I did not like that costumers bring their kids in this establishment. I should be a bit considerate but I just don't like kids running around me, while getting my nails done. It's a Salon not a daycare center. Also there's a woman with a short Bob hair cutt, DO NOT I repeat DO NOT go to her. She is always in a hurry and does a million things and talks on the phone while doing your nails. She does your nails fast and doesn't take her time, at least take a little time on someone's nails seeing is that you paid for the service to be done right, not quick and sloppy. I wish I knew her name but I just know she is short,skinny and her hair color is burgandy and it is cutt into a Bob, if you get her you will have sloppy not so neat nails. All the other employees do a great job on nails especially on French & American manicures.

0.description: I really like this store and their selection of clothes.  We went in after a day of Raggin' trying to find my daughter and outfit for my brother's wedding.What drew us in was the displays we saw in the window it was different than some Rainbows in our neighborhood. They did check our bags and I still think that this is a crazy policy because a person who wants to truly steal will even if you have my bags up front.The manager was very nice and helpful.  We needed a dress off the mannequin because it was the only one that was in my daughter's size.  It didn't seem like it bothered her at all she took off the dress handed it too my daughter with a smile.I laughed because she had to place another shirt over the bosoms of the mannequin but hey I understood it was just something that made me chuckle.My daughter said she would bypass all the Rainbows in our neighborhood just to come back to this one and that's saying a lot coming from her.The young lady at the cash register was very nice and the store was clean.  I will be back!!!Enjoy!!!

1.description: This new family business is great.  They have a wide arrray of dulces, candy mainly imported from Mexico.  They are helpful to suggest or explain where any of their product line is made or to showcase whatever is new and tasty!  Last and not least, the prices are very fair.  La Capital is a good place to get what authentic and delicious enough to keep making tripS back!

0.description: Great prices, great owners ready to help you navigate through the store.  I had a craving for some obleas with cajeta de leche and magically this store appeared. Nice mom & pop shop that also carries cajeta de leche de vaca direct from mexico.  I'm not talking the plastic bottle stuff currently sold in grocery stores, this is the real deal - and really affordable.  Now I was initially very happy with these discoveries, but after I scarfed the third oblea, and I started thinking about fitting in my summer clothes then reality set in....I better cool it and limit my visits.If you have better self-control than I and want try some yummy mexican candies, give this place a try!!

3.description: I have had good and bad experiences with this place. I regularly visit this place to purchase bakery goods. They are one of the nearest places with chocolate covered strawberries but now their prices have gone up and each strawberry is now $2 each.Anyway, in May of this year we ordered a Sweet 15 cake that was for 150 people. It was marble with strawberry filling. It was delivered on time and in good condition and they followed our design requests.In July, we ordered a Sweet 16 cake for 150 people as well. The cake was delivered late. The theme of the cake was supposed to be candy land so we asked for some large lollipops as the toppers on the cake. The gentleman who delivered the cake by himself cracked several of the lollipops and simply left them all over the cake and did not bother to fix it. For some reason they also put feathers in the cake which was not part of the original design at all (feathers with candy???). I had to glue pieces of the lollipops together so that it would be harder to tell that they were broken.My mom (the Sweet 16 cake was for my sister) spoke to an employee about the problems and the employee said that my mom would get a call to try to come up with some sort of solution for the bad experience but the bakery never got back to her.

1.description: I knew I should have gone to Bon Bon or Sprinkles bakery first but I was so blown away by how pretty this bakery was, and trying to support a small local business that I thought could handle my order. When I spoke to the owner Mayra and brought color pictures of exactly what I wanted, I said "I want them to look exactly like this", and asked "can you do this? if you can't its ok I'll just buy some pan dulce" (I needed them in 4 days so I still had time to shop other places) and she said yes that La France Bakery could make them like that, they would be smaller but that she would use fondant which would cost me more money, and so I paid $44 for 12 cupcakes. When I picked them up, these cupcakes were embarrassing, I thought I can't let people know I paid for these and I actually thought of switching them from the cake box they came in, to a cupcake pan. No fondant on any cupcake but printed edible paper, totally not what I paid for. I was too sad/shocked/disappointed to be angry so I paid and left.So after this all sank in about an hour later, I drove back to the bakery with all the cupcakes. Yes they gave me a refund, but now what. So I ended up buying a chocolate cake that they had on display. As I was leaving with the $40 basic cake and the cupcakes, the lady told me to leave the cupcakes because she refunded me for them. I left them but I would have figured that because I was walking out with a cake that I didn't want but had to settle and pay for because of them, and the waste of my time, gas and money (yes my money because I could have got the cupcakes I wanted somewhere else) that they would have let me take those (its not like anyone was going to buy those). Point being DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE WITH A CUSTOM ORDER, yea they can charge $$ for it but they can't deliver what they say they can.

2.description: This place might look nice from the outside but don't let it fool you. We asked for a custom cake and they couldn't do it. The cake was dry and it sucked. It look like someone did it sloppy when they wrote the happy birthday. We asked for flowers and basketballs and they put balloons. Customer service sucks and they were so rude. Never again. Worst $80 spent.

9.description: It's great!! . . .  until it isn't.This bakery stands out a bit with the faux facade (not trying to be redundant there) and the overly pink decor.  When they first opened I was glad to see a local merchant move in and take pride in their surroundings and not just their own plot of land.  They started putting out pink and white chains around the grass near their corner, they placed chairs at the bus stop, and even swept away debris around their lot plus the sidewalk.I'd walk in there from time to time and order some treats which were quite good (considering I don't ever crave sweets) and got some for friends who commented on the combination of great taste/price.Then a neighbor ordered a cake for his son's birthday.  I didn't feel so good after the meal but thought it might be due to something else I ate.  Then his child was throwing up violently ALL NIGHT in the crib.  The other guests got sick.  The common denominator: the cake.

10.description: After reading some reviews about their good cakes and their nice staff, I went there to order my baby shower cake. The staff were rude. I was asking about prices and they weren't sure what to charge me. The lady giving the prices gave an attitude and left to the back. So the girl who was taking my order just have me a price (which was a little expensive). I decided to make the order because it was a last minute thing and I thought that if its good, it would be worth it. My husband went to pick up the cake and when he brought it home, it wasn't what I expected. The design wasn't nice and it didn't taste how the reviews described it(I ordered tres leches with cheesecake and coconut). Their pastries are expensive and are not so good either. For pastries I would rather go to "la central" on 55th ave. or "le Paris" on Pulaski.

4.description: Ordered two cakes recently for my sister and cousins bdays. Both of them had designs, hers was Barbie and his was Macho Man. We get there the day of the party to pick them up and after waiting 20 minutes, they give me two extremely generic cakes without any designs like we asked. A blue and a pink one that just said happy birthday. The lady said that the two that we ordered were discontinued which is bs because we ordered through the owners who even gave us a discount. Why didn't they call and tell us beforehand! Instead of ruining the party and telling us when we pick up the cakes. Very unprofessional and this place has definitely lost some loyal customers.

6.description: I have a BIG sweet tooth and I come here once in a while to get goodies to have with my coffee.  Their fruit  empanadas are my favorite.  I prefer coming hear because other Mexican bakeries that I go to have a lot of conchas and other dry, semisweet breads.I rather have something with a gooey filing and icing....mmmmm  I think I might stop by here after work ;-)

12.description: My bf got me a tres leches cake (not pre-ordered) from here for my birthday this year.  It was around $30 and it was huge!  And basically everyone said it was the best tres leches cake ever.  Well-made, pretty, nice and flavorful, and not dried out like some tres leches cakes you get from other places.  I would definitely recommend the cake here!  :)

5.description: They have terrible customer service, they didn't make my cake how I ordered it and when I called them the same girl that took my order was the one that answered. She said, "We made your cake the way you ordered it" and she also said 'You're supposed to read your receipt to make sure your order is right" 2 things, they need to train this girl better or she doesn't belong there because she doesn't know how to deal with customers. I've always ordered the same flavor of cake there and never had any problems except for that time when that new girl helped me. I talked to the manager, he said they would call me the next day which never happened.

11.description: i always order my cakes from there the owners are really nice and if you take them a pic of the cake you want they will make it for you. my favorite one is the 3 leches con cheese cake

8.description: CAN YOU THINK OF A WORD OPPOSITE TO YUMMY??? Well this is it. I bought the biggest cake they had for a party I hosted.. everything in my party went great.. The food, the drinks, the music but when the time came for the cake everybody said.. Where did you get this cake??? And I was like why do you like it?? they said no I just want to know WHERE NOT TO GO WHEN I BUY ONE.. Imagine how you feel after paying almost 90dls for something like that.

0.description: I absolutely love this bakery!  The Tres Leches cakes are works of art - so delicious as well as beautiful!  The Paczki are amazing - every single flavor!  You must try!!!

7.description: This is by far the best cake ever. I always order cake from here for any party that calls for a cake (or not the point is to have cake) Their tres leches cake is delicious. I have tried different ones but some of my favorite are pina colada, strawberry and caramel. They also have cake slices, so you can have different flavors.The place is a little too pink, but I come here for the cake not the decor. La France Bakery. Best tres leches cakes in the south west.

1.description: This place has ample seating and menu items but this review is only for the Grecian chicken.THIS IS THE BEST CHARBROILED CHICKEN THAT YOU WILL EVER TASTE IN YOUR EVER LOVING LIFE!!!Whew! Sorry...I had to go caps to get that out lol. But seriously, the chicken is life changing. It's everything. Perfectly seasoned. I mean the flavor is soaked into every ounce of chicken down to the bone! I haven't really tried the sides or bbq so I can't speak on that but the chicken is outta this world. You must try it. Get the catering half pan, eat off of it for a week and thank me later lol!

9.description: Food is good... Service is terrible, while waiting for my food the cashier and cook were arguing very loudly, the cashier also tried to keep my change it's was $5.. Because of the service I won't be going to Nicky's anymore. It was my first and last time

23.description: COME HERE AND HAVE THE CHICKEN CHAR SANDWICH(best in the city), ive been coming for as long as i could remember(20+plus years)!!! that being said the Grecian chicken is very  very good, the chicken pita  and chicken salad are good, but trust me get the chicken char sandwich is the best! other things ive had through out the oh so many great years are the gyros(huge), the big baby(that what you call a double cheese burger on the S.SIDE ), the beef's, the chicken everything(because the chicken is grrrreat here) are all recommended. yes the hot dogs arent the best but they are average. its pretty big in here so you will have no problem finding a place to sit, they also have a huge parking lot.

25.description: This is an excellent fast food place with a Greek focus.  Gyros, Grecian style chicken, and a great Greek chicken salad all being the highlights.  They have really good hamburgers and beef sandwiches I hear.  I would avoid the hot dogs because they don't use Kosher or Vienna dogs - the rest are icky in my opinion.  Generally, I stick with the chicken salad.  Hot, freshly grilled chicken, tomatoes, feta, romaine lettuce, olives, a tangy Greek dressing, and a hot pita for $6.  It's EXCELLENT!  I highly recommend it if you find yourself in the area.There are TONS of Nicky's in the city - make sure you are at the real one!

12.description: Food is good. I like mex pollo dinner.

21.description: THe Grecian Chicken Is awsome.....Really cool clean place. Personally i usually take mine to go but the outside seating area is cool. Also good choices are ITALIAN BEEF, CHICKEN CHAR SALAD, GYROS

16.description: For shame Nickys!  $0.80... $0.35.... $0.69 what do these numbers have in common?  Prices for things that are generally complimentary at other restaurants but Nickys nickle and dimes their customers over.  $0.80 refill from a self serve pop machine.  $0.69 for sauce on the side.  $0.35 for a cup of water!  Really?!?  I know it's not situated in a nice 'hood but like the guys on Monday Night Football countdown, "Come on man!"  Were it not for the above mediocre food I don't know what would keep people coming back here.  I mean not even McNasty charges their customers for a cup of water.  And don't get me started on their "buy one get one free gyro*" scam.

17.description: I love in Niles and will drive all the way here for there Grecian chicken, chicken gyros & big baby (double cheeseburger ) awesome fresh delicious food w/ healthy options!!! Love it!!!

10.description: YES; FINALLY; WHEN THEY SAY FAST FOOD, THEY REALLY MEAN IT HERE!!!  I didn't wait but 6 minutes to get my 2 rib tip orders & burgers.  It was fast, clean, the guy was firm, clear & polite!  I came here before but I don't often make my way over this area much.  It is worth the stop.  My only peeve; they don't put the white sandwich bread slices under or right on top of your ribs to slop up the juices because there isn't much to slop up.

5.description: The food is great. I go there often. They give you the food fast and they are friendly. Just Sucked that they took the free refills off.

11.description: I used to love this place!  It was the go to spot for fast food!  But the quality in food is not as good as it used to be.  Portions have gotten smaller and the prices have gone up. The meat in the Italians beefs seem rubbery now. Soo disappointed.

22.description: I absolutely love Nicky's. My favorite is the Chicken Sandwhich. I usually get that sandwhich and fries with a cup of cheese. The prices have increased recently, but where haven't they! My grandma love the gyros and big baby. There are booths you can sit in and it's very clean. And the greek chicken is really good too, full of flavor. :-)

0.description: HHHHHmmmmmm??!! Is it possible that Gage Park has healthy food for take-out? Oh yes it is! My goodness... Nicky's char-grilled Grecian chicken is delicious! I'm really really surprised because I think this is the best tasting chicken I ever had and it's not deep fried! I got the whole Grecian chicken family deal which includes a whole chicken (already cut up), salad (with feta cheese, olives, and cherry tomatoes), salad dressing, garlic bread, and fries. This package is good for 3-4 persons. At home, I just made a chicken salad by putting chicken bits in the salad and added avocado and voila...a guilt free meal!!

20.description: I went to Nicky's last night and I have to say that I was somewhat disappointed by some changes made.  First of all, the prices were raised (and they have a large sign indicating so) which I suppose is ok.  But unfortunately, in addition to the price rise,  the portion of my gyros was quite a bit smaller.  Also, after over 40 years, they have changed their fries to a slighly larger and coated variety which are definitely not as good as the original.  The fries are ok,  (very similar to Burger King's) but not nearly as good as they used to be.

19.description: "the Real McCoy", as the Nicky's menu states.I stopped by on a whim after hearing some good reviews of this place from friends. Had the polish and the big baby for less than $7. Was in and out within 7 minutes.The interior was more spacious than I expected for a fast food joint in the south side, and there are sit-down booths as well. The food was great, not to mention affordable. I will be back!

2.description: I've been coming to Nicky's for years. This is a place where the food is delicious and the service is great.

18.description: Now this place knows what's up. They were in the trib a few times so I finally decided to make the hike and check it out...quickly found out they live up to their name of "the Real McCoy" as there are plenty of imitators, which I quickly learned just driving in the area. Upon recommendations, I got the chicken sandwich...and it was the best I have EVER had. NOTHING compares to the thickness or taste of this chicken. It is charbroiled (excellent idea) not to mention the wait time was absolutely zip, even during lunchtime when it was busy. The store was clean and the employees were polite. Prices are competitive, and this is a great change from the usual fast food garbage. You definitely get what you pay for here; and that's quality. I have gone back a few times since and experimented with more of their food. These are my recommendations: ANYTHING chicken: salad (always romain), sandwich, pita, dinners, you name it. Ribs were pretty goodBig Baby (Double cheeseburger, grilled onions, mustard, ketchup, pickles...i feel like this should be the trademark burger of Chicago)Gyros is always greatPolish sausage, awesomeNot really a fan of the hot dogsFor comparison purposes, I honestly could say this place can go toe to toe with Portillo's, as far as food taste. The grilled chicken sandwich puts Portillo's to shame. I will never order a chicken sandwich there (or anywhere else) again now knowing about this place's chicken. This place is my new hidden gem.

13.description: How can you taste so good then give me such bad diarrhea!? I felt tricked.

4.description: If you want some short order than you just might fall in love with this place as I did many years ago as in like nearly 30 was the first time I was here, It has been about 15 years since I was here last. I need to make it a point to not wait so long in between visits.My Big Baby was EXACTLY like how I remember it. Extremely delicious!. Compared to all short order burgers I have had in my life (and I have had many!) These are hands down the best. The service: well it is what it is young folks probably with one of their first jobs serving food. They did the best to their ability and were very personable which is all I can ask for. Going to to return sooner rather than later

24.description: "the Real McCoy", as the Nicky's menu states.I stopped by on a whim after hearing some good reviews of this place from friends. Had the polish and the big baby for less than $7. Was in and out within 7 minutes.The interior was more spacious than I expected for a fast food joint in the south side, and there are sit-down booths as well. The food was great, not to mention affordable. I will be back!

6.description: I never say very bad things but this has to be the worst food ever my beef taste nothing like beef the chicken salad taste the same as the beef and the pita bread was old I walked out and throw both meals away

15.description: I've been coming here since I moved to the neighborhood in 1995. I have always had a good experience coming here. Excellent gyros, polishes, chicken sandwiches, greek salads, the list goes on! I've tried other imitation Nicky's and none of them match the taste and quality! I would recommend take-out, the bathroom is scary last time I used it several years ago and the booths are ok. I always order my food to go. Not a large soda selection (RC, no Coke or Pepsi) but that's ok in my book!

7.description: One of my favorite places, love the staff there. The cashiers are awesome. The food is excellent, the place is always clean. I miss their full slab BBQ ribs :(. The cheese sticks are the best!

8.description: The salad is amazing and so are their chicken sandwiches. Service can be a bit slow sometimes but it depends on what you order. I also love their big baby minus cheese for me and the fries

3.description: My gf and I frequent nicky's on 58th and Kedzie Ave. When we need our grecian chicken or big baby fix. My gf loves their grecian chicken (dark) as well as I do. Their double cheeseburgers (big baby) are also delicious. I also like their chicken sandwiches but i always ask for it on a pita bread. I noticed not only do they just carry their delicious grecian chicken, they now also sell mexican style chicken (pollo asado) which we have not tried yet but does look good. There's always plenty of seating if you want to dine in and plenty of parking as well.

14.description: The Big Baby burger is great but, honestly,  the grilled chicken salad is excellent. Great take out spot.

0.description: I love Esmeralda, the salons owner. She is passionate of her job and you can see she loves it. She is a down to earth person, been coming here for 5 yrs already. Good hours due to my work schedule, only bad thing is her location.

3.description: The agua frescas taste artificial and have too much sugar in them. Pleased with the alpastor tacos but that's about it.

1.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE. I have been eating at El Taconazo on 58th & Kedzie for over 14 years even though I always order the same thing. lol. I love their pork meat. I always order pork tostada's with everything but sometimes switch up and order pork tacos or pork burritos. I have not found any other place who has the good pork. My family also joins me with eating there and they are fans of the ground beef, and the cow tongue. I love this place so much that i was very disappointed when i was pregnant in 2000/2001 that my developing child would not let me eat the food but yet this place is her favorite as well. I have never ran into any issues with this place. We been eating there for so long, the staff already know what we are going to order.....

2.description: Eww, Eww, Eww! This place is beyond dirty. When I came in it was summer and the place was swarming with flies. Avoid, Avoid, Avoid!

5.description: Um,  the place is fugly; dunno how else to put it.  The food is a hit or miss; they're really good at some things & suck royally at others.  I used to love it there 'til they cheapened their items down further.  They used to offer a thinned-out sour cream with your salsa & chips but now you pay extra for it, their hot chocolate is really runny & you have to ask for extra everything if you order their caldo de rez (beef stew) because if you don't they just bring you a plate full of huge veggie chunks & broth; no real meat; hell, even with the meat they will stinge you and add bones & such!  If you just want a cheap, good taco & walk over to the bakery right next door for some to-go Mexican sweetbread, then awesome, otherwise, go someplace else!

6.description: if you want authenitc mexican food & you're in the area, don't pass up this dumpy little gem in the minimall on nw corner of 59/kedzie.they have various dishes that include this great tomato-based sauce with sliced hot peppers which you can pick out to your tolerance to spicyness. and those are:-huevos rancheros: over easy eggs covered with this  sauce.-chilles rellenos: cheese stuffed bell peppers-bistek ranchero: thin steak with almost enough grisle to kill the dish. (substandard meat)-bistek a la mexicana: same as above but cut up.(my choice bet.the 2)also good:huevos a la mexicana: scrambled eggs with onions, tomatoes, & ( a little spicy) serrano peppers. i think they get carried away with the veg's in this dish, so i just ask for " poquita verduda" (just a little vegs)or just don't say anything & simlpy pick out what i don't want.huevos con chorizo: scrambled eggs with this mildly spicy mexican sausage. again, what is an otherwise great dish, they overdo the chorizo. i just ask for the chorizo on the side & mix it in to my taste.above caveats notwithstanding you can safely order any other dish without being dissapointed.yes, they have freshly squeezed o.j.you might want that food to go for 2 reasons:1) bad ventilation means you'll smell like food the rest of the day.2) as with a lot of mexican restaurants, the music is way TOO LOUD.other than that, enjoy

0.description: Idk, I'm not Mexican, but after a night of drinking this place is what l need. Recently I've been going before work and l have to said, this is my favourite restaurant for tacos, burritos, enchiladas, salsa and chips. One evening l had the beef soup, it was great, filling, flavorful and enough to take home. J really like this place.

4.description: The food is great but the service is SLOW and even non-existent at times. Chicken enchiladas-great! Chicken flautas-great! Torta de milanesa-great!

3.description: This has the worst drive thru service. It says their drive thru is open 24hrs. But, when I go to get coffee around 430am, no one ever answers me in the drive thru. I see people in there, but, nothing.

1.description: When you mess up the car in front of a customers order.m, you should probably make sure the next customer was correct!!! Apparently this is a regular problem.

0.description: Although the wait time in the drive thru lanes has gotten some what better I am still asked once in a while to park. On several occasion they have messed up my order however me biggest complaint is the coffee. It usually tastes burnt, when I ask them to put the cream in sugar/Splenda it's either too sweet or not enough. Sometimes the cup is not filled all the way. Instead even though it's a longer drive I go to the one on Pulaski.

2.description: Yea? That's how the person in the drive threw say everything I go there at night.no hi welcome to McDonald's just yea? Yea never mind.

5.description: Terrible McDonald's. Food is disgusting, the staff is lazy, it takes 30 minutes plus on the drive thru. I have complained many times to corporate, but it seems like no one cares. I stopped going. I hope everyone else does too

6.description: If i could give no stars I would.  This place has the most rude, incompetent, & laziest employees I have ever encountered.  This place is always running out of milk, ice cream, biscuits,  and other items on the menú.  A couple years ago I found out that this McDonald's is a training site. But that is no excuse for the horrible service. The only reason why I keep going is because I live a couple blocks away. I'm considering calling corporate and complaining but I feel like they won't care either.

7.description: I honestly got so tired of this mcdonalds I have not eaten mcdonalds in 4 years because of this locations bad service horrible horrible lines and just no words can describe the employees a few are golden but they don't stay .

8.description: I constantly come to this McDonald's because of the play pen. It is a clean place to take my kids sometimes in the winter. The persons that clean this Mcdonalds does a very good job.I also have had issues with ordering in this place like the previous reviewers say. Some workers are very good and others are very inept. I always order the caramel iced mocha. They either give me the hot one or the frappe and one time they gave my drink to another customer. It never fails. Like I said "ehh". I go for the family atmosphere.

9.description: This has to be the worst McDonald's ever.  They are rude, slow, inept and careless.  I  went through the drive-thru and it took over 10 minutes with my order wrong twice! I complained to McDonalds corporate and they said I could have a free Big Mac or something for my input and trouble and when I went there they said they don't do that at that location.  This is not the first time I have had problems with this McDonald's but it will be the last because I never will go there again.

10.description: The worst McDonalds in this neighborhood. Not only do they move slow, but they are also stupid. They always get my orders wrong. Avoid this McDonalds like the plague.

4.description: Worse place ever they always screw up your order , they always run out of things ,they never have ice coffee . Why because they are too lazy to make ice coffee this actually was told to me by a cashier, it's not because they sold out but because they don't want to make it. Imagine what they are losing in money and customers! Who hired that morning manager because he is lazy and doesn't care for the business.

3.description: They use too much cumin on the tamales. Heard from a few friends they've gotten better so I'm going to check it out and let you guys know.

1.description: El Milagro still dominates the tamale battle. Unfortunately, Rosa's tamales are miles apart from the good stuff...tale of two completely different hoods. The corn husk tamales were rolled thin like Tom-Tom's, and overkill on the masa. Pork with red sauce were bone dry, and both the chicken and rajas con queso tamales were sparse of their key ingredients. Hard to beat the price ($1.00), but there's much better around if you're willing to drive a few more miles.

2.description: Ehhhh the tamales are okay, I guess. The masa is too dry and not enough salsa. I have had better. Few people talk about how good they are maybe haven't experimented with other tamal places.

5.description: Menudo is delicious! I just moved from Los Angeles and was looking for a place that offered delicious authentic menudo. This was the place! The employees were great! Super nice and friendly. Price was very reasonable. $6, $8, $10 for menudo plus they package it nicely if you need it as a carry-out.  You definitely can tell its a family owned restaurant. We didn't get the chance to try the tamales but we plan on returning to keep trying the rest of the menu. : )

6.description: Their tamales are O.K. Compared to how I make them. Even though they are related to manolos tamales, they have better service and their tamales are not as dry.

7.description: The Tamales and Menudo are really good. I would give this place a higher rating, but they only take cash. Debit cards/Credit Cards are not accepted, so be prepared to take cash if you're going to order their great tamales and good food.

0.description: Tamales! Tamales! Tamales! This place is really good. They have really good tamales. The service is awsome and the drinks are the best. Tamales: regular tamal (corn husk) or Oaxacan style (wrapped in banana tree leaves). So many choices, chicken or pork, green or red sauce, Cheese and jalapeno pepper, Sweet tamales: pineapple, strawberry, pecan, all really good. My favorite you ask. well let me tell you that my favorite is the oaxacan chicken in green sauce. It is just soo good. As said before it is wrapped in banana tree leaves and it gives it a special flavor. The masa is so moist and not spongy like other places. Shredded chicken breast smothered in a spicy green tomatillo sauce. My mouth is literally watering just as I'm writing this. And now I know what's for lunch today, Lol. When I take it to go I top it with some extra green sauce, sour cream, onion and avocado and you my friend have what I like to call a super loaded tamal. They do have the best atole I have tasted. Champurrado is silky and so flavorful. It is taking me too long to wrap this review up and it is almost time to go to lunch so I'm just going say, good tamales, good service and good drinks.

4.description: I give this place my highest review. I've never had a better tamale. I moved to this neighborhood almost 2 years ago and missed the variety of the north side, little by little I started discovering the hidden gems around here. The tamales here are so tasty and you can taste the freshness of the masa. My favorite are the Oaxacan tamales, wrapped in banana leaves.....out fffffkkkknnnnnn standing. Go there, NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

12.description: This is by far the best nail salon I ever came across. this is my number one go to salon! My nails last a very long time, and I'm always happy with the outcome. Everyone there does an amazing job! you tell them what you want and they do exactly that, if not better. the only negative thing I have to say is the wait at this salon. there is always a line, but its worth it! I promise!

7.description: Went today, and this is definitely not a 5 star (or 4.5 star) place. It's cheap, but the mani I got was just ok.They didn't take off my clear polish I had on, so to make it smooth they put on a thick 3 coats. My nails weren't filed completely evenly. And the place was not very clean (worn disposable sandals laying around, nail dust everywhere, etc). Worst of all, the massage did not feel like anything. This place is not bad if you're just looking for something cheap.

20.description: I'm not a fan of driving down Kedzie because for as long as I can remember there has been some type of construction going on and it's just a Hot mess.  But because I received a generous gift certificate I thought I'd bear down and bite the bullet and get there alive.I was the first customer there at 10:15 a.m. and the guy who was setting up for the day was surprised to see me but quickly dropped what he was doing to set up my pedicure chair.  I was impressed at how clean and modern the salon appeared and the guy who took care of me was so thorough and patient.  He did an amazing job on my pedicure and manicure.  Plenty of parking as it is in a shopping center area.  Bonus:  TJ. MAxx is right next door! I wish this place was closer to me but if I can spend some quality time with my sister I may treat her next time.  Mani and Pedi for 32$  NOT BAD!Nice place...give it a try!

19.description: This used to be my go to spot for my nails but after Saturday June 6th, I will not be going back. We waited in a line outside for about 30 minutes before they opened the doors. They're supposed to open at 10am but it was at least 10:15 when they opened up and there was only one person there. They don't have ANY type of order in there. She seats everyone how they were in line but these crazy ass ladies who weren't in line cuts everyone who had been waiting forever. They finally start putting people in chairs and I was the 8th person in line. Some how 2.5-3hrs later I'm still standing up waiting to get my nails done very patiently UNTIL this woman who had been harassing Ken the whole time about her nails, gets in the chair before me. He put 3 people who were way behind me, before me. I was done. He had the nerve to get an attitude when my sister in law told him about himself. They have a sign in sheet but won't let anyone sign in. WTF. She was waiting for a pedicure and was sitting with her feet in cold ass water for at least 45 minutes before any one started on her. You know a place is bad when the customers have to tell the workers who is up next in the chair. smh. A girl was sitting next to my sister and they seated her in a chair with DIRTY WATER. They never changed the water and expected her to put her feet in there after someone else. Ken didn't drain the tubs until after the girl got really upset and told them. Don't go here if you don't want to wait 3hrs and be put behind their "favorite" customers.

1.description: I come to this Nail Shop because I feel comfortable. Not many places make me feel comfortable. I also noticed that every time I go to get my nails done, other customers are nice.  Meaning that you end up having a conversation and that's fun.

2.description: This place gets packed pretty easily but they do their best to accommodate everyone. Everyone is saying they have bad customer service but they're simply trying their best to get everyone serviced. All I can say is that I've been looking for a nail salon around here and they've all been horrible. This place is in decent condition considering the location. I got the best no chip and pedicure here that I've had in a very, very long time. The guy that did my no chip literally took only 20-25 minutes and they still came out perfect. He was great and I'll definitely be going back to him. They had a promo going on- if you spend over $50 you get a lotion or a pair of sandals. So I got a beautiful mani and pedi and a free lotion! The only bad thing was that I went on a Saturday morning and there was literally a line before the place even opened. They open at 10 but the owners didn't even get there until 10:30, I'm assuming that's why there was a line. Your best bet would be to go on a weekday. Either way- I love the job that they did here and I will definitely be back!!

9.description: Im all about giving credit when it's due and ranting and raving about my favorite places. I come here often when I can't make it out to the nail salon I normally go to. I like to get my eyebrows done by sandy who I believe is the owners wife. The other day I decided to get individual eyelashes done for the heck of it. I should of gone with my gut after I saw the price was on 25$ (Most who do eyelash extensions charge 85+) but I just thought to trust sandy. The worst 20 minutes of my life. She had my chair propped straight up so uncomfortably. When she began on my lashes, she held my eye open the whole time not allowing me to blink much. Between my eyes stinging and watering and her jamming the lashes directly under my eyelid, i wanted to scream. God forbid you ask for your money back at these places. I was beyond upset, and dissatisfied that she would rush on a TUESDAY to jam lashes to my eyes so she could tend to other customers. I even let three girls go in front of me so they could get their eyebrows done first before taking up sandys time! Never AGAIN will I walk into this place!!!!!!!

6.description: This place doesn't use aluminum foil to remove no chip, woman next to me had her hands soaked in chemicals for over 30min. Only got a pedicure

18.description: today was the worse day and last time I will come. There was a new lady...u could tell she doesn't know how to do eye brows...she did mine and my moms.. when she was done we still had wax on r skin...the lady was very nice but needs more practice .I was really upset at the end another lady rung me up. They have a policy that u have to spend $15 or more when u use a credit card ..I understand that, but what I found stupit was that my mom and I went today and I was going to pay for her and the lady that rung us up told me that we had to pay seperate that it was two different customers meaning two different transactions and we had to spend $15 each person...hello I just spend $16 that fits your policy...I told her no..... that we came together and I was going to pay for my mom...she still insisted that each one of us had to spend $15 to use a credit card...they shouldn't do this...they should have that policy just if am going with my family and if i want to pay they should let me..am still paying more than $15. The lady was very rude and mean ..am very disappointed and I hate my eye brows so does my mom...last time am going.

10.description: Best local place to get a pedicure!! I always get the signature deluxe pedicure by the older gentleman with glasses, his name is Bill, he is great!! He takes his time and pays great attention to detail. Add ur tip before credit card is rung!!  This is the cleanest place in the area. Most times the wait is too long and that's why I will not give them 5 stars Bc they should really try to hire more employees to get customers in and out. Nevertheless, they do have anywhere from 8 to 10 employees lol . I am a frequent customer specifically for my pedicures, best local place but not my favorite

13.description: Love this nail salon!! First I got here early on a Friday and was second to be there they open at 10am they do great pedicures and they really clean and file you feet not just throw water on them dry them then paint them like other places...and they don't pile on the acrylic either like other places I love my nails

16.description: I have been coming here for a while but today was the last straw.my sister in law and I got to the nail salon 20 min before it opened and there was a line so we get  in line. We wait for 10 that's when they open. Took them like ten minutes to open. So there  was a few people that where not in line they just walked in. Like really wtf  man. Anyway so they start to let everyone in and have them sit and ask them what they are getting done. So he tells me to pick a color so I do and I go and sit in the pedi chair. I was sitting there for 1 hour and half with my feet in cold water. So the two people sitting next to me where getting pedis the one on the right finished and proceeded to the eyebrow room. So they have a new person come sit in the chair the nail technician never changed the water ! Omg I told the girl do not put ur feet in that water they have not cleaned it out or drained the water. So we sit there another 20 min then the lady ask the girl are u getting a pedi . The girl was like yes I'm sitting here with my shoes and socks off what do u think I'm waiting for? So they send someone  to do her pedi. She had asked the older man like do I  sit here with my feet not in the water he was like yea. So they start my pedi and the girl and I notice that the same technician left another tub full of used water. When they came todo the girl pedi she was asked the technician if the water was cleaned he was like yes yes she asked him to drain the tub and clean it . He had  a attitude with her. At this point it's been two hours since we walked the door and I barely had a pedi . My sister was next and there was this lady who was complaing and the owner had the nerve to sit her in the chair talking about she needs to soak her nails mind u she had been sitting there as long as we have they could have started soaking her nails off when we walked in the door. The lady had just yelled at a girl because she had jumped her spot then she turns around and does the same to my sister . Like always the owner gives in to the people that bother him constantly so they shut up but doesn't care about the people that have been waiting there silently . They don't have a proper way of keeping track of who is next they try to go off memory or on the person that start to scream and shout is who gets in the chair. So in other words if u have 4 hours  and like other people pedi water then this is the place for u. So in two hours that we waited all I got was a pedi and my sister never got in the chair she did not want  to get her nails done after the owner sat the soaking lady down in his chair when it wasn't even her turn. !

17.description: This is the best nail salon, hands down, in Chicago. I love coming here. Best customer service ever. I have gotten a pedicure, manicure, eye lash extensions, full set, gel set, and waxing. I love that they have new polishes and they always have the newest Essie, Zoya, etc., collections. It's always clean and professional. I go often, if you couldn't tell. :)

15.description: Went in for eyebrow waxing. Service was super quick and my brows haven't looked this great in forever. This is going to be my go to place for my brow needs. I'm not big into nails so I cannot rate the nail service but I was greeted as soon as I walked in and was attended in 15 mins. Brow waxing cost eight dollars. That's affordable.

0.description: Whether it's fake nails, or just a regular manicure your nails will come out looking perfect every time! Plus the service is great, super friendly. Love it :)

5.description: I gave it an extra star simply because the lady who attended me did her job well. I don't come here often because the wait is simply ridiculous. I waited 1hr 15 mins before there was someone available to start my pedicure. Insane!! Every single manicure table was full and there was someone waiting in every single of the eight pedicure chairs. while all manicures where being taken care of in a more reasonable manner, there was only two people doing pedicures at one point! They should either staff appropriately or figure out a system to ensure they take care of people on a first come first serve basis. I saw a few people getting their eyebrows done and they looked great. Overall, the jobs are done well, but I will look for another place where I can get in an out faster

11.description: I give this place a low rating simply because the wait. This is the third time ive used this place and everytime you have to wait an incredibly long time even to get seated and then once your in you wait some more. I understand this place gets packed but they already know how its going to be so i dont understand why there always so short staffed the place keeps getting packed and they just work slower and slower! Ugh avoid this place if you can

8.description: Things to know:  Make an appointment! Add your tip before the credit card is rang up!This is a 5 star review because of the amount of perfection and effort that was put in to my manicure that has lasted me for over 3 weeks now and it still looks freaking perfect! I always get shelac, because I am too busy to try and upkeep regular polish on natural nails! The shelac manicure was reasonably priced at $30 (pretty much a standard everywhere). I was in town on a quick business trip and was trying to squeeze in some time to spend with some friends I hadn't seen in a while so time was of the essence to me as I wanted to be spending it with my friends instead of sitting at the nail salon for nearly 2.5 hrs. I called ahead to see if I should make an appointment and the gentleman who answered said no, come on by. Did not mention I would be waiting for over an hour before receiving my manicure or I would have requested an appointment. I was getting very frustrated because I was not there for a spa like time.. I needed to be in and out and was not. I arrived around 6pm.. Thinking I would have time to meet my friends at 8.. well I did not meet up with them still slightly after 9 and headed straight there after they were done.  So while the wait was very frustrating to me, one of my nails got messed up and the last thing I wanted to do was wait another 5 - 10 min to fix it, but I did have a very important interview the next day so I appreciated her doing it anyhow. If I lived in Chicago I would frequent this place and go to her Every-time. I wanted to give her a tip, however I asked her to ring my card right away so I wouldn't have to wait any longer, I did not realize that you needed to add tip prior to the charge. It seems like an easy fix that would allow the staff to receive more tips, so a recommendation to the owner would be to add a line so your people can get tips!

3.description: I've been coming here since they opened and only Kenny and Sandy do my nails and my brows. They both do a great job! The customer service is pretty good, the prices are reasonable and they have high clientele but it's worth the wait.

14.description: I'm not a fan of driving down Kedzie because for as long as I can remember there has been some type of construction going on and it's just a Hot mess.  But because I received a generous gift certificate I thought I'd bear down and bite the bullet and get there alive.I was the first customer there at 10:15 a.m. and the guy who was setting up for the day was surprised to see me but quickly dropped what he was doing to set up my pedicure chair.  I was impressed at how clean and modern the salon appeared and the guy who took care of me was so thorough and patient.  He did an amazing job on my pedicure and manicure.  Plenty of parking as it is in a shopping center area.  Bonus:  TJ. MAxx is right next door! I wish this place was closer to me but if I can spend some quality time with my sister I may treat her next time.  Mani and Pedi for 32$  NOT BAD!Nice place...give it a try!

4.description: I've been waiting for half an hour going on 40 minutes Asked the stupid guy in the front how much longer. Ive been waiting for a while He says "there's people in front of you...." Thank you. I know that but thats not question I asked you. They did my nails. And they basically look like crap. Its embarrassing

3.description: This place is like a ghost today but am sure it will pick up later when people get of work.

1.description: I can't really say much about this location but it  was clean.My daughter and I stopped in to see if we can find some shoes but we really didn't see anything that we wanted to buy.  I was surprised it wasn't a better selection of Heels.They also had a clearance sale going on but we were on a mission and really didn't check out their selection.I will be back but when I have time to explore the store a little more.Enjoy!!!

2.description: I was honestly surprised at the cleanliness of this store. Most TJMaxx's I've been to are incredibly disorganized and MESSY. I wouldn't quite call this one ORGANIZED...but it wasn't messy and was actually a lot nicer inside than a few of the other stores in the same mini mall. Unfortunately, I was looking for one particular parfume that is only available at TJMaxx and like 2 other stores. They didn't have the exact one that I wanted, which I understand, but I couldn't find an employee to help me, in case they might have had it somewhere else.I finally saw the girl at the cosmetics counter and asked if there might be perfumes in other places or if she could look it up and she told me "It would be pointless even if I could look it up, cause whatever's out there is what we got" Not very good customer service...Then I was walking around and there were perfumes in other little impulse buy areas by the registers. My perfume wasn't there, but hey! I found perfumes somewhere else...that she didn't point out.Again, a place I didn't have a fantastic experience at. It wasn't god-awful, but it wasn't great either.

0.description: Since Rosa J. has found pleasure in thrift-shopping, she hasn't been visiting a T.J. Maxx or a Marshall's as regularly as she should.  However, she won't completely ditch the discount stores because there are several advantages when shopping at Maxx or a similar store like this: 1) a massive selection of handbags and shoes: I prefer a brand-new handbag or an unworn pair of shoes.  I've realized that half of my handbags from my past "compulsive" shopping addiction weren't functional for my city life.  I would rather invest on a handbag, which would cost $100 to $150, but it will last a long time.  Shopping at Maxx for handbags is easy-breezy, without being bothered by sales associates.  For the shoes, I haven't brought a pair of shoes from a thrift store, yet I've purchased many pairs from Maxx and they last.  2) are you a fan of Michael Kors?  If you are, I saw lots of MK merchandise in this location.  3) organic shampoo, shower gel, facial wash, and hand soap: I haven't brought a drug store brand for some time.  My trick is to convert my credit card reward into Maxx gift cards, so my "reimbursements" have been used for this category.  This T.J. Maxx is very close to the CTA Kedzie Orange Line station.  If you're in the south-side area out and about, hit it up when you get a chance.

4.description: You know I'm really surprised at the assortment the cleanliness this is 1 of the best t_j max is I've been to a long time. Everyone should go check it out before becomes messed up like the rest.

1.description: This place is terrible food was cold glasses were nasty they don't have a large variety of dishes.Bathroom is disgusting it stinks not clean also ceiling has spots on tile its just despicable.Excellent price but not worth it the food didn't even look appetizing. Would not recommend it to anyone. If you're trying to save a dollar remember you get what you pay for and this place holds that slogan.Im shocked that its still open!

2.description: What can I say?  It's a Chinese buffet.  Quality is alright.  They have a stir-fry bar and a section where you can get make rolls (or, as American's frequently mislabel: sushi).Not half bad and not half good.  But doesn't disappoint if you wanna pig out!

0.description: I feel that it deserves 3 stars for the $8 the lunch buffet costs.  Even though they have taqueria style tacos on the sign outside, you will find stale hard taco shells with awful ground beef inside.  Everything was cold for the most part.  Food that is supposed to be warm just doesn't taste good cold.  The ice cream machine dispensed ice, the soft serve was the worst I have ever had.Some things you will find include a variety of chicken dishes, fries, chicken nuggets, fried fish, onion rings, chicken wings, carnitas, salad bar, rice, noodles, cheese pizza, and a poor dessert selection.  This sounds good but imagine it all being cold.   The standouts in my opinion were the carnitas and the apple strudel.  They were the few things that were warm.  This place would be 5 stars easily if the food was warm.  It's not the buffet's fault, however, I imagine it's hard to keep food fresh in a buffet setting with low turnover.

12.description: I attended this place for an event. The staff was very friendly and the food was perfect. The restaturant is superbusy. Price was decent. Plenty of parking and very attentive staff. They have security.

3.description: Terrible service ! I came with my in laws. First, they took forever to give us the menus. Then, the food took way too long to arrive. My mother in law ordered posole and had NO flavor. Tasted like pure water. She also ordered pancakes and said it tasted like fish. Pancakes wernt even cooked properly. I ordered eggs with chorizo and the chorizo was all burnt. The waitress never came to ask if we needed anything. We always had to call another waitress and all they said was they were going to go look for our waitress. Never again will we come back.

1.description: The service here is great, they start you off with a Mexican macaroni soup which to me was flavorless. The salsa de molcajete and chips are awesome! I ordered the green chilaquiles with steak, it came with rice and beans that were not very good. The chilaquiles could've of been a little less watery. I also had a homemade tortilla and it was good. The waitresses are very attentive and making sure your coffee cup is refilled. I think I can give it another try and order something else in the future.

2.description: To start pretty good on service has improved since last time I came. Ordered a torta carne asada with everything it was ok a lil salty but then tried their chilaquiles and I was impressed. My opinion I give 4 stars for the save of the chilaquiles.

9.description: Came here pretty late at night and there was just one other table in the restaurant that was also eating. I was visiting from out of town and was in the mood for Mexican food. I wasn't very impressed with the food, my burrito was very dry. The portion size was a little on the larger size so I was only able to eat half of my burrito. I will pass on this place next time I'm in town. My search for a great Mexican restaurant on the South Side continues.

10.description: I have been here numerous times over the years (my in laws love it). The breakfast is pretty yummy if your looking a typical greasy Mexican breakfast, but the lunch & dinner is just okay. I've tried a few different things but usually resort to the tampiquena because the steak is decent. The only seafood I have tried is their shrimp cocktail which is decent. The rice isn't that good either. Took away a star because some of the plates and side items (unspicey salsa!?) are bland and sometimes the place is loud when its packed and instead of just leaving the music and TV's at a regular volume they turn it up even higher making the situation even worse.

4.description: The food here is pretty good the Mole is so good I recommend you do try! The service can be better by checking up on the costumers once in a while. The restaurant is clean and the food is good!

6.description: I have been here often usally  it's  been good.Today it was awful ordered the steak and eggs, the steak was paper  thin and small. The server never came by to ask if everything  was ok and didn't refill the coffee. I think this place has gotten bad because  of  arogence, never going  back.
