0.description: This is one of my favorite restaurants close to the area. The food is good, clean, not expensive. Parking available. It would be better if they have have wi-fi for customers.I really recommend this place!

5.description: Las brisas del mar.One of those places that you visit and is just ok, not good enough to keep it in mind to come back but not bad enough to remember not to.I have been a few times and I gotta say some of their items are actually good, like their hand made tortillas and the quesadillas. But on the other side lingers the memory of the enchiladas de mole that were almost inedible. Last time I was here I had a quesadilla de huitlacoche and a steak huarache. The quesadilla was good and the huarache on itself was good but the steak was horrible, it was dry and had an odd taste to it. Service is nice and prices are comparable. This review is almost as bad as some of their food lol PS if you don't know what hiutlacoche is, ask my friend, he'll tell you, his name is google

13.description: The tortillas are very impressive, indeed.  As for the rest, it's middling to bad:(1) the grilled meat for my tacos was only alright -- neither good nor bad;(2) the nacho chips are either recycled or there is cross-contamination between the chips being discarded and new ones being put in the baskets (I found a chip that had obviously been used before in my second basket of chips) -- that's a bit gross; and(3) once I finished my meal, my waitress took away most of my dirty plates and then appeared to ignore me for the better part of 30 minutes; I had to ask another waitress to get my bill.  Odd, but whatever.I won't be back.

11.description: I came here with people who said this place was way better than one of my favorite Mexican restaurants, Nuevo Leon in Pilsen. I had chicken and shrimp fajitas, and they were just Ok. Personally, I think that part of the fun of ordering fajitas is when they come sizzling on a hot plate, and they just came normal. There weren't enough grilled peppers and onions, and their rice wasn't that good, either. So my meal was just "eh." I normally order chicken enchiladas at most Mexican places, and so I regret not ordering that to compare to other restaurants.Ok, a few compliments: 1) I was surprised they gave me enough shrimp, and the shrimp was very delicious. This is probably the place to go to for seafood; everyone I went with ordered shrimp. 2) They make their corn tortillas there, and they are very good. 3) Their guacamole is very good, but it's just guacamole. I would never come allll the way to the South side just for guacamole.Finally, I was very, very excited to see that they had mamey milkshakes because I hadn't had mamay-flavored ice cream since the last time I was in Mexico. It was the absolute worst milkshake ever. It only had a very tiny hint of mamey and just tasted like really thick milk. My mom, who loves mamey, thought it was disgusting. I had 2 sips and threw the rest out. Being so let down by the milkshake pretty much ruined my whole experience.Honestly, especially since I live on the North side, I'll never come back here again. I'll stick to Nuevo Leon and Cafe El Tapatio.

8.description: I come here  a lot!! They have delicious food!Handmade tortillas and tasty salsa de molcajete.The dishes are delicious and since this business is family operated you always get treated great!!Highly recommend this restaurant!! :-)

14.description: I know tacos, from Lengua to Cecina  This is one of my favorite places. I have been to Zacatacos, Pacos, street carts, Maxwell street,  I have been to Pilsen and the West side, the North side,  etc. These are my Faves.  The staff does not speak very good English and if you try to show off your 6 words of Spanglish they will just start talking to you like you are their Hermano.  The staff is always smiling and laughing,  a welcome sight, the vibe is nice although the big screen will usually be airing the prime time soaps at about 75 decibels.    What seperates Las Brisas from all the others is La Senora, every time I walk to the back door I take a peek into the kitchen and there she is, making tortillas by hand,  she makes them for every order to order, they are tender and almost have the texture of wheat, but with that earthy sweet corn taste.  One of the best tortillas I have ever had consistently. Their salsa is as unique as the smiling attitude, The sign outside reads salsa de molcajete, that means old school.  How old? About a couple thousand years of tradition.  Most home cooks and restaurant cooks use blenders for their salsa, Brisas uses a morter and pestle, the salsa is still hot, I don't think it is the best salsa by any stretch of the imagination, but it is beautiful and I am in love with the concept of someone  bashing chiles, tomatoes, and garlic together just for me.    The menu is large, excellent Shrimp dishes, the steak dishes are great with ample sides, but the standouts are the enchiladas estilo Guerero(sic) fresh handmade tortillas with chicken and a bright red chile sauce and just a sprinkle of aged cheese, served with rice that is always fresh and not all crunchy and some of the best refritos ever.  The refried beans are also representative of the detail in this restaurant, you can taste the toasted onion and the texture is always creamy instead of pasty, delicioso.  As far as the Tacos go, the el pastor is a no brainer, tender crispy roasted pork with just a hint of  pineapple wrapped in the aforementioned freshly made tortilla and garnished with the ubiquitous cilantro and onions, simple and absolute perfection. I have eaten here 20 times and have had only  one dissapointment, the dish escapes me, too much good to dwell on the negatives. The only thing I would stray away from is the chicken tacos, they seem mundane in comparison, besides why would you eat chicken tacos?  Other good choices, Enchiladas mole poblano, carne asada, taco de lengua(tongue)      To put this into perspective, if I had to chose one taco from the Chicago area to eat before I died it would be the El Pastor from Las Brisas Del Mare.  One word of caution, if you order a beer, ask for no salt, unless you like a lot of salt on the rim.  So please go now eat Tacos with hand made tortillas, drink Modelo with lime and be smiled at.

7.description: The Coctel de Camaron is on point! Like most Mexican seafood joints though, don't the non seafood dishes are not as good.

3.description: Nice place so many different things to choose from.. Ill be back although the lines were a tad bit long

1.description: Safe bet for traditional treats, needs some refinementPros:milk based ice creamwater based ice creamsliced fruits with hot pepperCons:expediencypresentation, techniquemenu that tries to be all things to all people... in high schoolTips:If the line is at the door, it's a 20 min. wait (no matter how simple your order)You come here for cones, bars, and slight modifications to traditional treats. I've had great experiences with those. At $1.75 per they add up but they're great on flavor. Cleanliness is acceptable given the high amount of foot traffic. The menu is rife with all sorts of ideas that were probably ok in concept. The execution is mostly average: Fritos and hot sauce in a bag with fork, frozen treats in cups doused with sprinkles, and many hurriedly prepared items.Service at the counters can be very friendly and sympathetic - very much appreciated. It's evident that the staff is trying very hard to be quick and friendly. Too bad the staff in the back isn't as thoughtful: dirty joggers, flip flops, and quite unwelcoming. I hope they're not touching any of the ingredients.Overall it's not bad. They're trying to cater to many tastes but I usually find that's not necessary. Perhaps if they slimmed down the menu it would help them focus more on quality.

2.description: Paleta de leche de coco is my drug. I think about the deliciousness day and night. Having this place walking distance is like a double edge sword. Most of their dessert treats and aguas are great. Although sometimes their agua de Jamaica is a bit too sweet. Their service has room for growth. Service is a hit or miss.One item I will never have from this place is their elote en vaso. They can never get the butter and mayonnaise ratio correct.

5.description: Best place w best flavors and best prices!! This is the original Michoacana in the neighborhood and by far my favorite!!

6.description: My best friend and I decided to make a trip and get some yummy ice cream and chips with cheese. Ice cream was soooo good. Downfall is that they took forever to get everything together.

7.description: The line can be long at times, but it sure is worth waiting for. Best fruit yogurts! Tortas de pierna, and strawberry malts!

8.description: Don't get me wrong this place is great for palletas, and yogurt but common the service is horrible I got here for a smoothly but it's taking forever by the time I had someone ask me what I wanted I could of had milk turn into yogurt by then ! Three people working and nobody has a clue on what they are doing

9.description: Today I found a hair on my Yougurt and this is not the first time the other day I found the lady who was doing my yogurt didn't wash her hands after grab money and and also I found a dead fly in the middle of paletas I never coming back here . The yogurts is good but you have to ordered without hair .

0.description: This place is the best. Vampiros4life. Long lines especially in the summer but totally worth it. I enjoy it especially in the winter because of the shorter lines. There is a wait if it's packed and you order a lot or you don't. 5-15 min topsThey've been lacking on the yogurts. The put like about half apples in the cup more than the rest of the fruit. Nachos or hot chips with cheese? Not nachos. The chips are stale especially by the end of the day and they also lack on the cheese. They put more cheese on the hot chips. I've haven't had they're food but it's an ice cream shop. I think they should just stick to drinks and ice cream and junk. Other than that the place is great but there is limited seating when it gets packed.I recommend the yogurt with the fruit and stuff, your choice of topping and the vampiro, my fav!

4.description: This place keeps getting better and betterMany places like this in this hood but this is by far the best. I go there pretty often and on my most recent visit ( around 9:45 pm) there was a line out the door. Really that good.Why an update? Well, they have an ever growing menu and it could be overwelming to decide what you want. But on the other hand you will surely find something of your liking. Some of the items are icecream, icecream bars....   As I pause to think about their menu I realize that it is more extensive that I thought....   fresh fruit water, tortas, hot dogs and burgers.Some weird items like: hot chips and nacho cheese, the other day I tried a vampire for the first time. It was crazy good, try to have your taste buds get a hold of this combination:  mango ice cream, chopped fresh mango, a squeeze of lime juice topped with chamoy (salty-sweet-sour-spicy tamarind based chutney) this vampire thing is crazy good and a contradiction of flavors party in your mouth that some how works great and will have addicted from the first taste.Tortas de pierna are so simple but so good. They also have burgers, but I have not had them and will not likely get them. Malt shakes, ice cream shakes, even some flan and cakes.Separate paragraph for their yogurt and fresh fruit. Weird name that Mexicans gave to this combination "atomico". Wide array of fresh fruit to choose from: apple, strawberry, mango, banana, guayaba, grapes; in a plain or flavored (strawberry, vanilla, pecan) yogurt topped with granola, chopped pecans and/or raisins. I like it but not but would not kill anyone for it. I did notice that about 50 % of their customers get this. As said before, huge menu, explore something different and you will for sure find something of your liking here. Crazy long lines sometimes, but worth every minute of the wait

3.description: Terrible terrible terrible!The meat was very hard(crunchy), the lemons were rotten, the burritos were ridiculously small, the service was "okay" & it was very over priced for what I got. I paid 50$ for 4 orders & now I have to go somewhere else to pick up food because my coworkers are ALL still very hungry & upset!

1.description: Love this place. It's cozy and clean. Been here a number of times and finally decided to leave a review. Every plate ive tasted has never been an disappointment. Service always been also the same, fairly good service.

2.description: I love this place... Great food and service... I uses to like the burritos de picadillo rojo.. But they dont have them no more...  Quesalillas are so good... With the taste of menonita cheese. Nice decor with fresh roses... Very clean.And friendly servers.. I really recommend this place.

5.description: Home made flour tortillas,  I'm there.There are very few places (actually this is the only one that I know of)  where they have have home made tortillas de harina. And if you are thinking what is the difference  well is like comparing store bought, regular bread to home made bread. I had been to this restaurant  when it was on Kedzie. Now that they opened in this new location I had to come and check them up again. I was there with a friend for Sunday breakfast. I ordered the Luna Gonzalez breakfast (really cool name ha?)  , 2 sunny side eggs, rice beans and poblano peppers and cheese with meat and grilled onions and avocado. Everything was good. They have some items that I have seen only here.They also have quesadillas, and they must be affiliated or got the recipe from La Reyna del Sur in the north side, and they give them credit for it. God forbids plagiarism in a Mexican restaurant in a land where most of them serve about the same fare LOL. But this makes up very little of their menu along with fresh fruit juices and smoothies.They also have burritas, not to be confused with burritos. Burritas are smaller and simpler. With only a few ingredients but very good as well. What is good about them is that they are made with home made flour tortillas. Gorditas Durango Style are big in this place, I wish I had tried a few. The service is nice, although they did take some time to bring the food. But I would like to think is is because they are taking time to caringly prepare my food.I am not a menudo person, in fact I have never tried it. And don't call the Mexican food police I know it is is crime that I haven't. Where was I going with this???? ..,.. Oh yea, they have menudo here (only on the week ends) and must be really good because more than 50% of patrons were having menudo. Maybe I will come back and try it here. Price wise, I would say that it is a little higher than many Mex. places around here (not crazy expensive tough) but again it is the little extra that they put into the food that might make it worth the small price difference.Keep an eye for the weekly special (good deal on good food)LPD It's good, it's slow, enjoy it. (with their home made flour tortillas)

6.description: seriously best mexican restaurant i've been to!! great service and great food.. i still cant get enough of tacos al pastor. their delicious. not expensive at all.

7.description: The taste of the food its good, but this is the 2nd time i stop by and they didnt have something ready for the lunch, and also they should have at least two people working the floor.

8.description: This place was just a typical Mexican restaurant but with one exception, its really nice inside. Great decor and atmosphere. The food however, its like a restaurant for little people. Luckily the prices also reflect that. I've been here twice to try various things to see if they had something that sticks out but no cigar. The tacos, gorditas, burritos, and all are small. Its like a Mexican version of White Castle because they are all like sliders. If you order 3 tacos at a place with good size tacos, it would take about 5 from this place. The waitress we had was not familiar with their own menu. When I asked her about what came in a gordita she would run back to the cook and ask him. Happened twice. They need their staff to be  pretty efficient with their menu, not just hire plane Jane of the street and tell her to wait tables.

9.description: What can I say?First the positives:This place has a nice decor and the  Deshebrada (Shredded Beef) was very good.That's it.I admit that their was some slight hype for this joint hell the day it opened it had a full mariachi and other things that made the whole reopening well festive that's right a reopening as it used to be on 5141 South Kedzie Avenue before moving to it's new home on 2423 51st St about two weeks ago. My family and I did not attend the grand re opening for a couple of reasons: the main one being that grand openings always sort of suck because they are always packed and  the service can be shoddy especially if it's a small or medium joint with a handful of tables and booths and let's be honest why go through all of that if the food is going to either suck or be below average? Then again if it's a knock out and the food kicks ass then I am the dumb ass with egg on my face but hey that's life.Well guess what guys I am not a dumb assBefore I start let me give you guys a brief rundown of what this joint is about in 5 fun and easy steps!1.They serve estilo Duranguense from the Mexican state of Durango which means you will see many dishes that you normally would not find in say a "Comales" or a "Zacatacos".2.Cheap Burritos between 2.50 and 2.993. Gorditas de harina (flour)4.Picadillo (minced meat with either green or red salsa)5. Dancing cooks and waitresses (OK I lied)So those are some quick facts and now to the review....When my family and I entered the place it was modestly packed and we had no issues finding a table to sit down and hopefully get the service that you would expect from good restaurants...well that suckedIt took at least 10 minutes before we had a waitress attend us and to make matters worse we had to deal with a filthy table that still had chips from the previous customers and not to mention a tip left for the waitress (about four bucks) and some other food related items on the table. Finally a waitress perhaps guided by her inexperience came to us and asked us if we are ready to order! Well we had no menus, old chips, and a dirty table in front of us so I guess NO! finally realizing the situation she went ahead and brought some menus took our drink orders and we figured that everything was going to be fine.Ah NO!After that ordeal we finally got a basket of war tortilla chips that where warm and delicious but then we tried the Salsa which was watery dull and flavorless and after a brief check up with the waitress she finally brought  us a thicker salsa that was tastier and spicier but still very boring. In the midst of all this we had already placed our orders and we waited and we waited and we waited..................... and then we waited a little more........... thirty minutes!!!!!!!!!! it was ridiculous it was like that scene from "Casino" remember when Joe Pesci had that guys head in a vice? yeah maybe I am taking that a little too far.So the food arrives! Hey remember the cheap burritos I was talking about? They  are nothing more than glorified "giant tacos" as opposed to regular burritos since they are not the same size as most other burrito joints. Take a regular sized or slightly bigger flour tortilla and add meat and cheese and then wrap it and then you get an idea of what I am talking about. However the best part about this is the fact that it featured some truly excellent Deshebrada that was the sole salvation of this place hence the two stars. I also ordered two tacos of tripitas (tripe) and they where completely average.Everyone else ordered one gordita,two tacos and two quesadillas and  they where all underwhelming with the big insult being that the gordita was lacking in meat and size and considering the price about 2.50 you would think they would fill it up but I guess this place does not care about portions.So recapping a little bit it was all what four tacos, one burrito, a gordita, and a quesadilla and that took 30 minutes? The general reaction amongst all of us was that the food was average and when you combine that with lackluster service and a dirty table and having to ask for napkins which should be a requirement for all eating establishments especially on the tables it's safe to say this place is terrible and want to know the final blow? taking into account all that we ordered which included some sodas and one large Horchata and an order of rice and beans the total tab was about 35+ dollars!  I personally believe that it's great in theory for La Placita de Durango to try and cook some would be inspired dishes from the Mexican state of Durango and considering the high amount of people here in Chicago that are actually from Durango it would have been great if they got a fair culinary representation but unfortunately La Placita de Durango is average at best and I don't think I will ever eat here again. Fin

0.description: Great little place I will recommend this place! The meat on the tacos is on the dry side but if you order something else on the menu you won't regret it! The portions are amazing! And the food is real good authentic Mexican food!

4.description: Back again this place never disappoints from there amazing food to friendly staff and ample parking.  If you haven't tried it yet you need to your leave full and satisfied .  If I could give them 10 stars I would.

28.description: Delicious pizza with the best crust I have ever had and ultra fresh toppings. This is a nice family owned business that really cares about the quality of their food. My husband loves spicy food and if you get jalapenos on your pizza, they have a nice kick! They also have buffalo wings and sandwiches that are really good, too. If you haven't given this pizza a try, then what are you waiting for?

1.description: I got two slices to go, one pep and one sausage.  They were amazing.Glad I found this place.They do accept credit cards, which is nice.

39.description: After moving to Brighton Park from the NW side not too long ago I went into food-shock.  My options were slim, and if I wanted delivery there were only a couple places.  Then one day I hear about Pizza Castle and my prayers were answered.  Delicious delivery pizza that stays open pretty late.  I tried a couple other places first (Piazanno's , Falco's) but none of them were as good as Pizza Castle.  GREAT thin crusts, they make the sausage there and it is very, very tasty.  Speedy delivery and really nice staff, this is my current favorite delivery.  I have never gone wrong with the King Arthur (Sausage, GP, Onions, and Mushrooms... mmmm).

9.description: Amazing pizza and fast service. This is in my parents neighborhood and I usually just walk in an order.  My parent went to a competitor for years until I finally brought a slice home. They've been hooked since. The sauce is sweet and the crust crunchy. Homemade sausage makes each bite unique. The place is too small thought. They've been in business for years, hopefully they're able to expand or get more locations. Chicago needs to taste this flavor!

29.description: The wife and I got a thin cheese.  I wasn't a big fan of the crust as it was too chewy, but the flavor of the sauce and cheese was great.  This is a friendly small joint in a little neighborhood strip mall.  Very good pizza for a reasonable price.

23.description: One of the best pizza's on southside......Familly owned can't beat the prices.Great bunch of people.......

5.description: Unfortunately I cannot give zero stars. I recieved no service, no food and only arguments from the staff. We ordered an xlarge pizza and were told to give them 45 minutes. Almost 40 minutes into waiting, we received a call stating they did not WANT to deliver to us. They wanted us to come in and get the pizza or they would refund us. They stated they didn't want to come to our area (which is nothing but family homes) as they had it clearly mistaken with another area. After I tried  to clarify they were mistaken, they continued to argue. So we opted for the refund. Horrible service.

31.description: I remember getting the pizza on Halloween and if you went later in the evening you sometimes got a few extra pieces.Their pizza is by far one of the best I've ever had. They don't need to change a thing.Since leaving Evergreen Park, I don't get it as often. I'm over an hour away now. But when I'm in the area I make it a take out night and bring home a couple. You just need to give it a try......you will be back.

25.description: Really like this place.. Thin crust was amazing and the service was excellent.

12.description: Good pizza here.  Tried it for the first time Saturday based on other reviews on here.  They also give you a free litter of pop with your pizza.  The pizza is comparable to geneos pizza which is close by.  And the prices are almost the same as well.  I'd come back.  But the other place is easier for me to drive to from my house.

37.description: This is some great pizza. I'm a lifelong south sider and GOOD thin crust is hard to find. This stuff is fabulous. They make their own sausage, and the sauce is nice and rich. The dough is some of my favorite in the world. I only order thin crust from Pizza Castle.

21.description: we had a large pizza last weekend a large sausage & chesse with one side pepperoni the other side mushroom and onions, they out did there selfs, it came on time like always and really nice and hot. it was fantasic!!!!!!!!!!!!! they are the best in chicago i say!!!!!!

16.description: Love pizza castle! Service is fast . And the people there are always nice!. There is Nothing better than having great customer service with your yummy food! I've had pizza from here many times. Never disappointing. Fries are good too and any other finger foods as well (onion rings, cheese sticks, Etc.) And the prices are always affordable! .

17.description: Called in for a pick up order. I asked if the coupons were still valid and the man said yes.I ordered a XL King Arthur and Box of wings with fries and I would get a free 1 liter pop. I asked to use the $2 off coupon and the guy told me to use the XL one topping pizza and box of wings with fries and 2 liter pop for $21.99 and just pay for the extra topping prices for a better price. So, I went with that. After I hung up, I even told my guy that he was nice and even suggested what coupon to use to save.Ok, so my guy goes to pick it up and when he came back he thought it was a bit more expensive than he expected. He said it was like over $30. Made me think.XL King Arthur - $20.45Box of Wings - $7.251 Liter Pop - FreeTotal $27.70 - $2 coupon = $25.70 + taxXL King ArthurBox of Wings2 Liter PopTotal $21.99 + $5.55 (3 ingredients) = $27.54 + taxI think it could've been a mistake, but I think the guy would know the menu enough to know which was a better deal. I know the difference is about $2, but left a bad taste in my mouth.The wings were a bit salty and the fries were meh. Skip these! Also, I asked for only half green peppers on the pizza, but they made the whole pizza with.Pizza was still pretty good though.

10.description: Almooossssst enough to get to 5 stars. Almost. So I have been thinking about my first experience and I believe I was a little cautious with my stars, this being a city built on pizza stones and all, those slices were easily 4 star if not 5.... I only knew after because I found myself comparing any pizza slice I've had since to them! So far #1, yet to find a better slice.This time around I opted for the XL King Arthur and again the sauce has a little spice and the crust around the edge of the pizza is crazy good and crunchy like real brick oven stuff! I think those 2 things plus the sausage are what makes it standout for me.The only thing holding it back from 5 stars for me I guess was I would've liked to see a bit more of that coveted sausage and maybe bigger chunks, also I do need to say that the XL is 16" not your standard 18" family size. That's it.This Pizza is awesome and I will go out of my way to have this every time I hit Midway.

11.description: Their pizza is the best. Tried it for the first time and I've been ordering from here ever since.

26.description: This is the best pizza in Chicago! growing up a couple blocks away from pizza castle, we had this delivered all the time! This pizza is so good I will actually drive across town to the old neighborhood to pick it up and of course take a spin past my old house

27.description: Called in for a pick up order. I asked if the coupons were still valid and the man said yes.I ordered a XL King Arthur and Box of wings with fries and I would get a free 1 liter pop. I asked to use the $2 off coupon and the guy told me to use the XL one topping pizza and box of wings with fries and 2 liter pop for $21.99 and just pay for the extra topping prices for a better price. So, I went with that. After I hung up, I even told my guy that he was nice and even suggested what coupon to use to save.Ok, so my guy goes to pick it up and when he came back he thought it was a bit more expensive than he expected. He said it was like over $30. Made me think.XL King Arthur - $20.45Box of Wings - $7.251 Liter Pop - FreeTotal $27.70 - $2 coupon = $25.70 + taxXL King ArthurBox of Wings2 Liter PopTotal $21.99 + $5.55 (3 ingredients) = $27.54 + taxI think it could've been a mistake, but I think the guy would know the menu enough to know which was a better deal. I know the difference is about $2, but left a bad taste in my mouth.The wings were a bit salty and the fries were meh. Skip these! Also, I asked for only half green peppers on the pizza, but they made the whole pizza with.Pizza was still pretty good though.

35.description: I grew up in this neighborhood and Pizza Castle was a staple in our house. I have to say that NOTHING compares to their pizza. They make their own sausage, which is out of this world and they have the best thin crust around, hands down.Ok, maybe I'm a bit biased since the owners were friends of the family. My dad delivered for them and my sister worked here for years, but that's besides the point. It doesn't change how good thier pizza actually is. Remember when they would give out little pieces of pizza to Halloween trick or treaters? Wonder if they still do that...Back in the day when you ordered, you always wanted your pizza made by Di. There was just something about how she made it that was so good. I believe they might have even added it to the menu (Pie by Di)?Anyhow, the place is excellent. A great family owned business that everyone should stop at if in the neighborhood. Hey, you may even run into the infamous Father Bob to have a chat! :)I dream of this place (especially since I haven't found anything as good where I am currently living)! I only wish they would deliver as far as Forest Park!

8.description: Yeah baby, love this place!  It's got to be the freaking huge oven that they bake the pies in that make them taste so darn good.I love the ambience and the fact that it's a neighborhood establishment and has been here foreva!Their ingredients are legit including the love they put into each order.  We ususally get a plain cheese and a sausage, mushroom onion and ask for them extra crispy.  Oh yeah, I can almost taste them as I'm typing.Prices are more than fair to experience a true old school Chicago style pizzaria!

0.description: I especially love Pizza Castle... As a resident of Chicago for over 28 years, I've had my fair share of pies. Hands down, the BEST pizza joint on the south side. Try it extra thin!!

38.description: I lived only blocks away from here for years. It was practically the only place I ordered from for more than 10 years. The thin crust is honestly the bar I have set for other places. I cannot recommend this place enough, and while I do live in Logan Square now, I occasionally find myself only miles from Pizza Castle and make it a point to pick up some pizza if I have the time. As far as pizza goes this is my #2 pick south of Madison. And they carry 1 liters of RC!Oh and I'm not sure if they still do this but I'd be surprised if they didn't. On halloween drop by with your kids and they have candy and pizza for everyone.

20.description: Place has great food. Had delivery from there a couple weeks ago and I must add that the customer service was great. The person taking my order was so nice and funny he made me feel so comfortable when ordering. Once I received my order the delivery driver was so polite and friendly. I use to do pick up but now that I have tried their delivery service I must say that I will call more often. I always get the special which is a great deal and enough food for a family a four. They have definitely gain another customer.  Glad that this place is so close to home.

19.description: I've been reading the other reviews for the Castle, as well as other pizza places. I have to say that if you're ordering delivery, please realize that some things just don't hold up for delivery--ESPECIALLY FRENCH FRIES! One could argue that all of the food should be hot when delivered. That's Pollyannish. Just can't happen. Fries are good for about 5 minutes after leaving the fryer. Cold pizza is a no-no but cold fries are a sure bet.

33.description: Really great pizza.  Last night I tried the cheese, sausage and pepperoni.  All were great.  They arrived piping hot just when they said they would deliver it.  The sauce was perfect - not too sweet - just right.  The crust (I had all three thin- I'm not sure if they offer others) was crispy/chewey and right on.  The sausage was again right on - even better than Home Run Inn (whose sausage has a somewhat sour taste to me).  The perfect amount of cheese was placed on the perfect sauce and crust.  They were great.  To be very truthful, if half stars were allowed I would have given it 41/2 stars due to two minor issues -  the first issue was that the pizza was definitely on the salty side and the other was that I prefer my pepperoni pizza to have the pepperoni on top of the cheese - not under it because it adds to the crisipiness of the pepperoni.  Having said that - these pizzas were outstanding!  I would definitely order from there again.  These are the best pizzas on the South Side.  Better than Nick and Vito's and even better than Home Run Inn.

2.description: Everyone raved about the pizza, so i had to try it. Ordered for delivery. Freindly service over the phone. delivery was quick.....was really looking forward to trying a new place for pizza......um....pizza did not hit the spot....nothing that made this pizza place stand out from other local pizzerias...sorry.

34.description: Great thin crust pizza - very very tasty with good sauce and crust and ingredients.  We always get sausage as at least one of the ingredients and it's great.  Doesn't taste unhealthy when you eat it though either.  Best pizza we've found within a couple miles radius.Doesn't have eat-in area, but has an area to sit down if you do pickup and you can watch the dudes make pizzas.

32.description: The most underrated pizza place on the southwest side of Chicago. The key to the distinct flavor of their pizza? The massive old-school cast iron oven that literally takes up more than half of their space. It gives a wonderful warm and aromatic scent of the crust along with a crispy fresh texture. They even sprinkle a bit of flour to their double-dough pizzas, and it adds even more flavor.My favorite: medium double-dough well-done with sausage and mushrooms. Do it!

18.description: Decent place when you are in the company of others enjoying a few drinks. I like the wing basket with fries and chicken sandwich. Remember to ask for ranch otherwise you will not get any.

13.description: Awesome pizza, friendly service, great prices. If you want quality, this is your go-to place. Ive been coming here for about 5 years now, and the consistency is still there. Its a nice family owned business that I still support, and one of the very few places I know still use brick pizza ovens, the best way to make a pizza! Highly recommend!

4.description: I've ordered from here several time they are great!!!and super consistent! They are truly my to go spot for delievery of pizza. Well worth the price and the ingredients are always very fresh. Love the employees, always have a great experience no matter who I deal with. Highly reccomend. My favorite Pizza in chicago

24.description: I wanted to like this place after a friend told me about Pizza Castle and reading the reviews here, but this pizza was average at best.  I ordered an XL sausage.  The tape measure, brought out because the pizza looked small, indicated it was a L.  That had no bearing on the taste and quality of the pizza.About 10% of the pizza was not edible because that corner was extremely burned, not well done, but burned.  When the pizza finally arrived at my house, 1 hour 39 minutes later, I am just under two miles away, the pizza was barely warm.  The fries were cold limp grease sticks.  Their menu, that states, "We Get "Em Hot To Your House" and "REALLY FAST DELIVERY" proved to be false, at least in my experience. I would have been better off putting in a frozen pizza in the oven, it would have tasted better, would have been hot, and I wouldn't have had to wait so long. I am on the fence as to whether I want to give this place another chance, if I do, I will post another review, and hope that that experience lives up to the hype and reputation.

6.description: Sweet treat when I'm visiting relatives. I've been coming here for years and the pizza is always great. Rick, Rich and Tim have always been good to us when we visit. This is by far a neighborhood treasure.  The ambiance is definitely old school decor. They have pictures of all the neighborhood trick or treat kids for every year. You can see them making your pizzas as well. We asked about par bake and they stated it can be done!  They have shipped to Ohio amongst other places, FYI.Pizza is great tasting.  I personally like the thin crunchy pizza. Sauce is quality with fresh ingredients and they have their own family made sausage. The texture is perfect with every bite. It's way on top of my list for good pizza in Chicago.

22.description: Sweet treat when I'm visiting relatives. I've been coming here for years and the pizza is always great. Rick, Rich and Tim have always been good to us when we visit. This is by far a neighborhood treasure.  The ambiance is definitely old school decor. They have pictures of all the neighborhood trick or treat kids for every year. You can see them making your pizzas as well. We asked about par bake and they stated it can be done!  They have shipped to Ohio amongst other places, FYI.Pizza is great tasting.  I personally like the thin crunchy pizza. Sauce is quality with fresh ingredients and they have their own family made sausage. The texture is perfect with every bite. It's way on top of my list for good pizza in Chicago.

15.description: One of the best pizzerias in Chicago. With delicious sauce and sausage made in house this just might be the best thin crust anywhere close to the south side. Def worth every penny

40.description: I lived down here for a while a few years ago and found this place.  I didn't realize at first, but this was the same pizza place (in name) that I had grown up on in the '60's (it was on Ashland near 51st then), but they still had the same pizza ovens!  Very good, fennelly sausage, and lots of it. traditional Chicago thin crust. if you're in the neighborhood stop in for a slice/pie.

7.description: Went for the first time, enjoyed the pizza.  Can't say its the best hands down, I can say that their pizza is very affordable and taste great.  I have no complaints.

36.description: I absolutely love this place.  I make the drive out from Naperville on a regular basis just to get their thin crust sausage pizza.

30.description: Oh my goodness! This place is delish! I found this pizza joint from yelp and it did not let me down. I do not eat pork ~ but the parents do and I love the fact that they make their own sausage. I go for the spinach, onion, and cheese. Either way it is great.I am always on the hunt for a good thin slightly greasy thin crust pizza. This one hits the mark!Good job Pizza Castle!

3.description: If zero stars was an option I would give them zero stars. We ordered a pizza for delivery... they said it would be 30-45 min. Shortly after the 30 min mark passed (probably closer to 40 minutes) someone called saying they wouldn't deliver the pizza. My credit card had already been charged. We were told to come in to eat the pizza but wouldn't be compensated for the time we had already waited and the inconvenience of having to leave to go there. According to other reviews the pizza is good but from my experience the costumer service was terrible. Very disappointed.

14.description: Ordered a large tomato and spinach  pizza.  Sauce was ok.  Vegetables were not very fresh. Not sure if that is because the time of the year in Chicago but a restaurant should be able to get fresh ingredients.  There are a lot better pizzas in the Midway area then Pizza Castle.

3.description: horrible service! was just in there and the girls were so into there conversation i had to walk out after waiting 5 min!!!! no one else was in line. never going there again!!!

1.description: My local dunkin donuts. The usual dunkin donut taste everything is good and tasty but the costumer service is horrible the group of girls working there would rather be talking to each other than helping you! Especially the manager who has such a bad attitude so you can't even complain but report her to the board!

2.description: This Dunkin Donuts is absolutely 100% horrendous in customer service, sanitation, and merchandise. Every single time, and I mean EVERY SINGLE FREAKIN TIME, I've been to this location (and I've been living in the vicinity all my life, so go figure) I have had nothing but an awful experience. The employees are ALWAYS rude, ghetto and just disgusting. They always have some stupid excuse as to why you cannot order your latte, coolata, etc. Whatever it may be, there is an excuse as to why they can't make it. I've heard: The machine is dirty and needs to be cleaned so I can't make it, there is no coffee ready, I'm the only one here and don't know how, etc.UUMM EXCUSE ME? instead of sitting on your ghetto ass and biting your nails texting your baby daddy, why don't you F*ing clean it? or make the damn coffee?? I mean it's ridiculous! and they always behave like you're somehow disturbing them or inconveniencing them. From what? who knows. I've gotten a nasty attitude and even eyes rolled at me for simply walking in and wanting to buy coffee and maybe a sandwich or a doughnut. One time I actually ordered a meal (one of those sandwiches with hash brown) which, I guess takes a little while to make and I was fine with waiting, however, this employee had the audacity to slam the register shut after I paid and literally grunt out loud about having to make my sandwich. I mean, wow, really?. I was just appalled. Another time, I went in for doughnuts. I noticed that ALL the doughnuts were placed under the wrong labels/names. So as i'm calling out my doughnuts of choice by correct name, this rude employee is getting angry at ME because I'm correcting her on the wrong doughnuts she's grabbing. Oh and then I get to work, sharing my doughnuts with my coworkers only to find that the doughnuts were stale and cold. I was horrified. I have vowed to NEVER go there again and you bet I reported them to the City of Chicago for a sanitation code violation because these disgusting employees always have their hair down, hair messed up like they rolled out of bed and sticking out of their cap along with their NAILS DONE!-- which is totally against sanitation code for toxic reasons. and some times they were wearing no cap or gloves at all. Done with this place. DO NOT GO THERE.

0.description: Honestly this WAS the best Dunkin around my neighborhood that I could go on the quicks and the employees were super polite & always got my order right. But since a female employee started working here around 2nd shift, I literally don't even like going here anymore!!!!!! She always has an EXCUSE for something. Which have been....- the breads are frozen- we don't have sugar (which I went around 4PM!!!!)- we can't make ice coffees right now- we don't have straws or napkins anymore( I went around 2PM)FOR EVERYTHING she has an excuse and I got tired of it and also my mom.My mom actually asked another employee "why was this lady with a bad attitude when someone orders something?!?!?" she said " we have gotten complaints from her from MANY customers and she don't change"SThe NEXT day my mom went to Order the $1 ice coffee & the lady was there and She was so POLITE To my mom which she has NEVER been like that with my mother or I....

4.description: This place is ok for what it is. It's not a stand alone Dunkin, it is inside the GoLo gas station. The staff is pretty good and the coffee is like any other Dunkin. In the summer time though it feels like they don't have A/C. I feel like it should be a ding on them because if they are going to place a chain inside a gas station they should be making sure they can get the minimum standars for their customers.

0.description: I'm still drunk happy New year breakfast same ole diner fare.

If you're forgiving.I've been going to this place for a few years now (just once or twice per) and will say it's not the most professional or best designed place you'll ever walk into but the customer service has never been dissatisfying and the prices are helpful.  There are definitely much more experienced florists in Chicago who also design and arrange better but if your floral recipients don't have highly discerning tastes, then this place will be just fine.Vases:Not the best selection, but they're not horrible to look at and they'll do.Flowers:Actually pretty good.  I've been to several florists in Chicago and, yes, there are times when you shop at a very fancy florist only to receive non-immaculate flowers.  I think many of us believe the more we pay, the better the product will be but flowers are flowers and a rose is *just* a rose.  The one thing I definitely don't like though is the wrapping paper/plastic they use.  It tends to get real cheap sometimes.  *And* they don't have those plastic water capsules that you see other florists place at the bottom of the stems.Arrangements:You'll definitely find better in Chicago but the staff here sometimes makes some really nice ones.  If you're looking for something that won't let you down, it might be better to visit here and pick out something that's already been put together but I wouldn't necessarily place an order and then get my hopes up that it's going to be stunning.  Store Interior:Definitely low expense.  But the staff is friendly, courteous, and they do try.WARNING:They spray their flowers with a fragrant aerosol, even the roses.I always have to remember to tell them to NOT do that.  Why they insist?  idk.  Perhaps it's the clientele they're used to, maybe it's a south side thing.

3.description: I love this place. From their tacos to their gorditas and one of my personal favs the burrito de asada. Pick up is usually ready within ten minutes. And if you're dining in the service is good. I see that some reviews complain about multiple waitresses checking in on them but I believe it's just out of courtesy. I do not tip each one I just leave my tip on the table and walk away. I love the agua de tamarindo although all of them are great.

1.description: My favorite place to go eat after work. Best tacos and gorditas around. Awesome service and even better food. I always recommend this place since it's authentic and will leave you wanting more

2.description: Tacos were  authentic... Just like I like them!!! Al pastor y lengua are the best so far. Waitresses are polite and fast. I will definitely frequent here more often.

9.description: Al pastor gordita is the best!

10.description: This is my favorite place to go for big steak and seasoned pork tacos, always juicy never dry, cant complain about their gorditas! Yum!

4.description: My go to place when I think of getting a Burrito. El Especial burrito is not one you should ignore. Always flavorful, always savory. This place is very consistent with their food. Not once when I have eaten in or taken out that have I had a bad experience. Their agua de Jamaica is refreshing. Not too sweet, not to bland. This place is one of the few places that is open late so it's a plus that the food is great. Definitely your $$ worth.

6.description: My wife and son and I ate here for breakfast. They each had chicken burritos and I had one beef torta and one potato and chorizo gordita.We all thoroughly enjoyed the food! The bread on which my torta was served was light, fluffy, warm and absolutely delicious. All ingredients were fresh and tasty. The location is a bit out of the way, but worth the drive. Also, the help speaks very little English, but they certainly helped us through with ordering (the menu is in both English & Spanish). Also it's cash only.

12.description: I have been going to place for over 7 years and it one of my favorite Mexican restaurants! The food is so delicious that it gets really packed on weekends. I have had almost everything from the menu like the torta, gordita, tacos and enchiladas and everything has been delicious!  I highly recommend this place!Overall, the service is friendly.

5.description: Great place but it's always crowded so I'll rather take out. Delicious food but they always take long even after they told me to pick it up in 30min always takes me around 10min to receive it. But other than time wise it's a great place to eat!

11.description: TRIPE TACOS!TRIPE TACOS!TRIPE TACOS!TRIPE TACOS!It's that simple these are the best tripe tacos in the city and maybe the world because the tripe here is well cooked and seasoned and they make you want to order more and more! I recently reviewed the other place as well and I can honestly say that this joint beats it in terms of it's tacos! and superior service you will get promptly attended here and you don't have to wait 20 or so minutes to get your food unlike the other joint on 3322 W 47th St ( read my review on the other Haciendita for the differences between both eating establishments) and to clarify this place is a total win for the tripe tacos alone they are truly the best of the best, that is unless you hate tripe and if you do well shame on you!Bonus points for attractive waitresses (not to be a sexist but there are some really fine mamacitas here;)FYIIf you don't speak english don't worry they will work with you k.

8.description: Really good real Mexican food.They do authentic Mexican food, and they do it right. So I had had  tortas, gorditas, and burritos and everything is good. My favorite here are the gordita de asada with cheese and rajas (poblanos pepper), veggie burrito is some how different and so good. Bisctec a la Mex. is also really good.I'm crazy about champurrado and the good thing is that they have some killer champurrado here. The bad thing is that they have it only in winter. They also have mex bottled drinks, horchata and jamaica.Service is really nice and attentive, you may have a little language problem but they manage. The place is nice and simple. It gets crowded on the week ends, and I mean crowded. But is is worth it. Price wise, it is pretty affordable.La Haciendita, good authentic Mex food and good service.

0.description: Killer tacos. Simply Miu Bonita. I eat a lot of tacos all around Chicago. Most don't get on my Yelp page cause they're average or even slightly above. Not this place. Onion/cilantro only, served with a bowl of limes.

7.description: Best Tacos ever. Everything is fresh love it here !

12.description: Best Chinese food restaurant in gage park, never disappoints me. when ordering they have good understanding of what i want i had never had a wrong order.

7.description: I placed an order for delivery and they were very prompt. I ordered orange chicken, vegetable egg foo young, crab rangoon and a mango smoothie. The food is good. The prices are reasonable and the portions are pretty good.  I'm sure I'll order from here again.

19.description: the food here is very good.. I have been going to this place for years.. the orange chicken, chicken chop suey, combination rice and veggie egg rolls are the best.

1.description: Fast service, your food will be ready within minutes. The crab rangoons are delicious, as is the kung pao shrimp, and the menu is extensive. The hostess/cashier is slightly rude but no other complaints.

2.description: I love this place! It is family owned and it's the best chinese food I've ever had! The prices are cheap and they're quick with delivery too. Been going here for as long as I've lived in the neighborhood and will never go anywhere else. Only giving it four stars because their tapioca smoothies can be smoother.

9.description: Love this place! Food is  great!  But I gave it 4 starts because the delivery service sucks really bad!  1 and 45 min wait for 2 meals! Ridiculous! It's order for pick up the way to go or dine in.

6.description: Love the shrimp egg rolls and the jumbo shrimp fried rice. If you're into spicy food try the spicy orange chicken and the jalapeño fried rice. One of my personal favorites is the salt and pepper shrimp.

18.description: glad i decided to try this restaurant with my girlfriend after reading all the reviews online !what i really like about the restaurant even before entering is the TV they have installed by the window. It was very catchy with the slideshow of all their dishes. Very creative ! i ordered the orange chicken dinner special and my girlfriend had the jalapeno fried rice and a banana strawberry smoothie.First ill start off with the orange chicken special. it came with shrimp fried rice an egg roll, a can soda. the orange chicken was very good it was crispy and the flavor was spectacular ! the jalapeno rice my girlfriend order was nice and spicy with crunchy jalapeno with shrimp and beef. i believe this is the only restaurant that serves this kind of rice ! must try if you love spicy ! also the smoothie was very good with chewy boba balls .. really makes you want to try all the flavors ! we combined 2 flavors and they didnt charge us extra like the other restaurants do which is a big plus ! will definitely come back again ! must try !

10.description: Best chinese food on the south side! For real! I usually order the wontons and dumplings. So damn good.

13.description: Love this place!! Great food and service  The lunch special is the best for about 6 bucks you get your choice of entree,shrimp fried rice, egg roll, and a pop!! Eat here you won't regret it!

16.description: In this Neighborhood.............................The Best There Is, The Best There Was, The Best There Ever Will BeNothing comes close they are the KINGS of the Block and the Best Orange chicken and Shrimp Fried Rice you can eat and best of all it's still a family business and the owner is a true gentlemen and keeps this place Alive and Delicious.

17.description: Best in the area. Even better since they renovated 1 or 2 years ago. My fav is their Kung Pao chicken. Never dissapoints. Best in the area and anyone whose eaten there knows it.

15.description: This restaurant has very good Chinese food. I'm especially a fan of their Crab Rangoon and Shrimp Fried Rice.My parents have been ordering from here since they got married. In fact, I recently learned that this is the first place that my parents went to eat (*sarcasm* how romantic). My dad always gets take-out, so I don't remember ever going inside the restaurant.Its a definite choice for Chinese if you live in the area.

0.description: Been going as a kid they made it smaller for a more fast convenience service. With the change of the area.but the food is still great & great price with a lot more for leftovers

5.description: Wouldn't go back.  Cheap generic flavorless Chinese food.  Barely ate any of it because you can taste all the msg and how old the oil is they use.  Not fresh.  Best part was the tapioca in the smoothie which wasn't great itself either.  Disappointed yelpers.

11.description: Always on point! I've lived in Gage Park since I was 7 and have tried other places but they aren't as good. Always consistent with the quality and the people are friendly. Not much of a set up inside but the the food speaks for itself.

8.description: Im not really sure what people see in this place. I decided to give it a chance based on the reviews, but I will never trust a single review ever again. This wasn't even authentic chinese, and the fried rice was just white rice covered in soy sauce! The food went right through me, it was a horrible experience. You're much better off visiting china town.

3.description: Love their food! They have fair prices and they are fast in delivery. Friendly people. Best Chinese food!

14.description: For $4.20, I got two huge Vegetable Egg Foo Young patties and a box of steamed rice (this was the "small" version)...Score! Quick and friendly service at pick-up. Maybe the best bang for your buck I've ever had.

4.description: I ordered from here based on all the positive reviews. The food was very bland. No flavor ever popped out. My order was ready in 10 minutes. The best tasting thing I had was the veggie eggrolls, that all!

1.description: Mediocre Food...Nothing Special. Just a typical hamburger joint. Try the Italian Sausage/Beef Combo on French Bread. You won't be dissapointed.

2.description: I drive back to the "old neighborhood", monthly, for this tasty treat!  Their cheeseburgers with chili and a large curly fry(you now have to ask specifically for)can only be topped by enjoying them with a milkshake!  You wont be disappointed!

0.description: This place used to be called the more appropriate "Pete's Custard Corner", and has been at the corner of 51st & Campbell since before my parents moved on that block 33 years ago.I grew up on this food. Its Greek-owned and offers gyros, but they specialize in burgers, fries, and milkshakes. Their prices used to be a steal, although in recent years the economy has forced them to be on the same level as fast food chains. I don't eat beef anymore, but I used to (don't like the taste). However, Pete's burgers were one of the last things I'd eat with beef in it. The hamburger patties are super thin, and they'll add chilli as a topping if you ask. Now I usually get the chicken pita or chicken patty - both good.Now their fries. For years they had the BEST curly fries around, but they discontinued it a while ago. However last year they introduced them again ONLY on Saturdays - better than nothing! The regular cut fries are still good and thick.Their milkshakes are really good and they always complete my meal.If you're in the neighborhood, this is the place to get your burger & fries (and milkshake).

3.description: Good place for beer and snack.. Been a long time customer like 6 years ago purchased my first beer at this place the staff is ok but sometimes they get busy and are rushing you off there's rude customers on weekends but I guess they are just trying to get their medicine and get out as soon as possible.. Prices are fair and yes the parking lot gets wild on weekends!!

1.description: Great selection from cava to craft beer bingo!

2.description: been going here since we moved into the neighborhood 8 years ago.  Great selection of beers, wine and booze- If you can't find it ask George and it'll be there the next time! Hidden Gem!

5.description: Minny Binnys. This place carries a large selection of beers. I was shocked they didn't have Magic Hat #9 and asked the owner where it was at. He freaked out and placed it on order because he felt like he let me down. I always order my kegs here all the time. They are cool peeps. Sometimes they'll have attitudes but you can't blame them because drunk ass dudes irritate them. Oh and the best part is, some weekends they'll have all sorts of tequilla/beer girls giving out free samples. Yes!!! Love doing shots while shopping!

6.description: This old school place is a gem. They had two kinds of rye a pretty large selection of bourbons, tons of vodkas. I forgot to note their gins because it is January I guess. No Creme de Violette, but I don't think anyone in town has that. The beer selection is fairly large and best of all, the prices were reasonable. It is not a superstore so they may not have every single beer on the market today, but they have a broad collection of spirits.Wine? I forgot to look and would not know what to look for anyway. They had some.The staff was super helpful.

0.description: Where did all this craft beer come from?!My family has been coming here since I was a little kid in the late 70s. It's always been a dependable, well-stocked neighborhood liquor store. If there was a liquor you were looking for and they didn't have it, you'd let the owner know about it, and they'd track it down for you. That kind of place. Very helpful and friendly.However, (back then) they didn't have much a selection of American craft beers, although their import selection was well represented and pretty impressive.Apparently, that has changed in the last two years. I don't know how I missed the craft beers when I came in a couple months ago, but today I just realized that they have an immense selection of local and imported craft beers. There must have been at least a hundred different types, probably much more. The only other liquor store in the area to have this kind of selection is Archer Liquors, and I've found a couple beers at Town & Country that Archer didn't stock (and vice-versa, too.)So, if you live out here in Brighton Park/Southwest Side area and need to get your beer fix on without having to pop in downtown to Binny's, Town & Country Liquor (as well as Archer Liquors) is your place!

4.description: I live two blocks away, so it's easy to get to.  The staff knows me by name and are very nice.  The only negative to this place is the parking lot.  If you visit on a Friday evening after work or on weekends, the lot is a packed frenzy of semi inebriated people who can't figure out how to park or pull in and out of a parking lot.  Just be careful

0.description: Great discounts! Different, more youthful merchandise than the other "discount" stores

3.description: If I could give zero stars I would. I've been ordering from this place for years never had a problem. I recently moved and wanted my favorite pizza but wasn't sure if they delivered to my address. I called to ask and the man asked for my address and I didn't even finish giving him my address when he snapped and said "NO!" . This guy always seems to have a attitude when he answers the phone but I shrug it off because their pizza is amazing. But after his little tantrum today I think I'll settle for dominos. Thanks Natyz you probably just lost a loyal customer. Great job!

1.description: Bad service. Guys are rude. Got my food 1 hour and 40 min when they said 45 min. They didn't get an order of wings when I ordered two orders. Didn't call since they didn't charge them but he clearly repeated my order when I called. The cheese is nasty. The pizza wasn't even that good. I had way better pizza. The wings were okay. Never ordering from there again.

2.description: I've been ordering pizza form Natys for the last 15 year and there has never been a issue with disappointment.

5.description: Horrible customer service. They charged my pizza and fries. Told me 45 min. An hour and a half later,They delivered only a pizza. Called and asked for my fries since the delivery man already charged me. Another hour later still no fries. Called and asked for a refund. The owner on the other line started cursing at me. 35 min later my fries are delivered even though when I complained. Not once did they ask for my name or address and I called from different phones. No I will not be eating these fries. And nope. Never ordering from this place again

6.description: I'd always go to the Naty's on Chicago and Wood, and I absolutely loved the food and service. I thought the same quality of service would be shown in this location and boy was I wrong. The register man seems like he has absolutely no desire to work there. Just asking him for a simple favor like making the food to go seems to irritate him. The food is great, which is why I continue to order there. My recommendation: order food for delivery and avoid going in shop at all costs!

7.description: The pizza came ten mins after the hour, had to call the place to ask where our pizza was. Pizza came extremely cold and very expensive for a tasteless pizza

8.description: They are Allright blacklisted for a while I still order you speak Spanish better service lol

9.description: HORRIBLE SERVICE! I ordered from there when we went to visit my sister-in-law because she said it was good and fast. Well wrong because when we got there and we said our name for pick up  the guy kept ignoring us after a few people we asked again and the guy finally told us they didn't make our pizza and instead of saying sorry he was still acting like a jerk! Well never again will I go there and the place look dirty!

0.description: This place has been around for many years and it hasn't changed much. I like ordering the chicken sandwich or double hamburger. Most of the time delivery is within half an hour. My biggest complaint about this place is they usually mess up my order. I ask for no cheese and 3 out of 5 times they will put some on there. I also get my hot dog plain and they usually mess that up as well.

4.description: Been ordering from here for yesrs, never ran into problems. A family favorite, our pizza always comes out delicous.

0.description: Their bread is ok. They are stingy with the pastries that have cheese filling. All the ones I purchased had very little and almost no cheese filling but I sure did pay like it had plenty of cheese. Their cheesecake was VERY bland. Hardly any taste what so ever. Their Tres Leches slices where really good though. I really did like their pastel de tres leches but I most likely will not be going back here. The other bakery that I go to gives you a bigger BANG for your buck.

3.description: Everything here is delicious. I am a huge fan of pollo express in pilsen. When I found out that they were opening another location with an expanded menu I was so happy. Been here several times and have tried pretty much everything on the menu and nothing has disappointed. The tortillas are made fresh at this location and they offer arracheras, cochinita pibil and birria. Sometimes they run out of things, but I'll just order something else. No biggie. My go to restaurant in Gage park. And they take credit cards at this location. Yay!

1.description: Okay, I'm bumping it up a star. The food is good here, but still have those little flaws.Steak Taco - This was good, but she really put those onions on it.Half Chicken Combo - Chicken was hot and moist. They gave us refried beans this time, but I don't eat beans, but my guy had no complaints.Chips and Salsa - They actually had two salsas this time. One was smokey and one was more like a pico de gallo salsa.Okay, my guy asked for water and they had ice. YES! Well, I got a can of Coke and it was barely cold. BOO! Only one thing worst than warm Coke and that's NO Coke! Will be back for sure!

2.description: I had the half chicken special, side of beans (charros) and rice with a drink. The chicken was cooked well and seasoned perfectly. It was juicy and tasty. The charro style beans were quite tasty. The rice was fluffy and cooked correctly. The portion is big, I could not eat it all. The service was fast and friendly. The dining area was clean and well kept. I would definitely go back. It's a fast food place but feels like a very good sit down restaurant.

5.description: After a barrage of "ya gotta go here and try the chicken and arrachera" from my co-workers, my wife and I - big foodies - paid a visit last night and were pretty much wowed by the flavors, the service, and the clean organized nature of this new opening.  (By the way - this is a "city worker" haven at lunch, so you know it has to be good!).  The indoor grill with mesquite wood is a wonder in itself.  It is so well attended by the staff, that we got tired just watching them work so hard to keep the fires burning with fresh coal, and keeping a watchful eye on the chicken grilling on the suspended wire rack.   Then there's the guacamole guy.   He mashes the crap out of the avocado with a cup in a huge bowl for a long time, producing an incredibly creamy dish.  Absolutely the best guac I have had in the city!!  I had the Arrachera Combo of a 10" steak, cebollitas, guac, charro beans, and not-your-typical Mexican rice for $13.95!   The steak was so tender and flavorful from the mesquite grill.    My wife had the Chicken Bowl ($6.65), that is basically everything you put on a taco, but assembled diced up in a bowl for you. All you have to do is make your own tacos if you want, or just eat out of the bowl.   The mesquite chicken is so juicy and tender.   The restaurant is modern and very clean.  The workers labor very hard in the open kitchen, manning the grill and dicing up the fresh ingredients. It was nice to go into a clean, modern, un-graffit-ed  bathroom for a change!!  This place really does steak and chicken right.  Go and enjoy "the show" and a great Mexican meal.

6.description: Always pass by this place since it was opened and wondered what the food was like. My mother in law ordered take out and to my surprise the chicken was great. They were fast, prompt and food was flavorful!

7.description: from the charcoal grilled chicken to the seared crust on the tortilla, this is what burritos aspire to be.  putting one of these delicious monsters into your facehole is a religious experience.  it sometimes takes a little time for them to make it, but that's because they're artists, lovingly crafting a perfect burrito experience for you to enjoy.

0.description: Great mexican chicken you get a lot for your buck will be back soon

4.description: Have you heard about that chicken place on 18th St that is super famous??well they are some how related.I saw that this place opened and knew that I had to check it out. a couple of moths passed by and never made it here till last Saturday.Usual morning for me, relax all morning long, then have brunch and relax some more, or so that was my plan.Long story short, sister call me, pick up nephew from airport and drive him to NW IN. Not before I eat something. We pick him up and I made the mistake of asking them were did they want to eat? Oh big mistake, I don't want this or that, not that place, I don't want Mexican.I just drove them here and told them we are having chicken, lol.I had seen the menu before and some of the dishes looked great. We get there and park right in front. One whole chicken with, rice and charro beans, arrachera plate and quesadilla de pollo. I had seen on their menu some interesting side dishes, e.g. ensalada de nopales (cactus salad) but they did not have a few of the sides listed on the menu so -1* for that.Aside from that, everything else was right on, the chicken was flavorful and moist, rice and beans were solid good, salsas are pretty good. Arachera plate was perfect. Perfectly cooked arrachera, rice, beans and guacamole. Hand made tortillas for it all.Nice place, cool service and unbeatable prices.Def a  come back place for me

3.description: I'm somewhat disappointed with this CVS. While I understand why there is no liquor department(neighborhood), there is NO reason for this store to skimp on sale papers or updating the sale tags. I had to go outside to the front door and read the LONE sale paper more than once to verify which products were on sale. Becuase the sale tags are as old as 2010!The plus side is that is has quite a bit of ethnic(mexican) food offerings, and is typically in stock for most items(something the downtown stores fail to do). Also plenty of parking.

1.description: This CVS makes me sick. I had the misfortune of coming into this establishment with my tiny dog, and the idiot store manager by the name of Adrian Gonzalez, without any consideration for my poor dog, made us leave the store. It's winter outside and I will not be leaving my animal outside to freeze to death. What if I was blind? And needed a dog to help me get places? You didn't think of that one did you Adrian? Well CVS, you can thank Adrian for the loss of a good costumer, I don't live too far and came to CVS for all of my needs but now... I will not be spending another dollar in here. Not if you guys employ heartless, unsympathetic, down right rude employees. I would think someone in a higher position such as "store manager" would think about benefitting the company he works for, but instead drives clients away, thus making CVS lose money. Good job buddy. I will now tell everyone I come across to never set foot in there again.

2.description: This CVS location has a big parking lot and is convenient if you're travelling on Western Avenue.  Inside the staff is helpful and mostly bilingual (spanish).  The pharmacists are also helpful but sometimes need a hand when many prescriptions are being processed.  Otherwise, this is well stocked location.

0.description: Not the cleanest cvs but still have good deals

28.description: They have the best Caldo Tlalpeño in Chicago!!!! The staff is very nice. The service is not fast which makes the place even more authentic. The wait is worth it!!! Try the Picaditas and Huaraches. They are also very authentic, not really catered for a non-Mexican familiar palate.By the way, go there only if you are very hungry. The portions are large and include homemade tortillas. If you are not very hungry, you can split one entree with someone. They will give you some salsas and totopos, but make sure you ask for the authentic one (la que pica), it's great!.

1.description: HORRIBLE SERVICE AND OUR FOOD TOOK OVER AN HOUR TO COME OUT! I ordered a soup and my friend had 1 huarache. Also my water had a bunch of stuff in it and I told a server and he said it was some chile or something. Took him 10 minutes to bring me another cup of water. Not going back.

9.description: I was there for lunch, they a subwoofer hanging from the ceiling that pounds so loud. My daughter ordered asada tacos and got boiled ground beef tacos.I ordered flautas the tortilla was chewy instead of crispy just bad food. I would recommend going only if it's the last mexican restaurant in the area.

29.description: One of the only places I know of where you can get huaraches, which are these amazing tasty (and probably bad for you) sandal shaped, mexican pizza-like things. It's  basically fried dough with beans, cheese, lettuce and a special salsa on top.  Their huaraches are wonderful and I'm  basing my whole review on them because I haven't really tried anything else.  In terms of ambiance, I give the place a mas o menos... pretty similar to other low priced taquerias although they do have a full bar for some reason. The cheesey spanish pop music was turned up a little too loud for me. Like, I could hardly hear myself think over all the passionate man-pop they had playing.  But it's very inexpensive and  whatever else you think of this place, you'll heart the huaraches, they're o-so-tasty.

23.description: My friends and I decided to stop by here for some quick food because we were waiting across the street at the muffler shop. The place looked nice and it was sort of busy from the outside. It was our first time here and we ordered a steak burrito and steak tacos. What can I say...the steak burrito was amazing and the tacos were on point. The steak was seasoned really good and the cheese was melting with each bite. I have eaten at a lot of taco places that are good too, but I will definitely come back here in the future.

5.description: Real authentic mexican food delicious .  Very clean, always busy service just ok .. waitresses could be nicer  .. remember 'costumer service'  its really good we'll be back .. soon

25.description: Love this place! Parking lot is pretty small so you may have to park on the street. I always order the Platillo Teloloapan, which mysteriously did not make it to the new menu they launched earlier this year. Ask for it and they will know what you're talking about. It comes with 2 flautas, 2 enchiladas, rice/beans with their very tasty mole. Salsa is pretty good. They just built out the tiny restaurant so it now has a separate dining room with more tables. I definitively recommend it for the mole! My mom is a fan of their Micheladas.

12.description: My husband loves this place so he brought me here & now I love it. It's one of the few Mexican restaurants with real hand-made tortillas. All their food & tortillas taste like real Mexican authentic food unlike other places. They also have liquiados (shakes) and different juices like carrot, beets, orange juice and the traditional drink horchata. I truly feel like I'm eating at a Mexican restaurant in Mexico when I come here because the food is authentic. Service is great too. Must try.

21.description: This is a small neighborhood hold out that is consistently busy.  In fact, I thought that that food at this location was much better than their location on Roosevelt Rd.  Service was like a well oiled machine. I really enjoyed their "caldos".  This past Sunday, I tried the Caldo de Pescado, and it was terrific.  Beautiful pieces of what I thought was cod ( the waiter told me it was catfish....but I think he was incorrect....way too flaky and lacked that "muddy" flavor that even farmed catfish has.)  In any event, I will drive from the north side to eat here again.

16.description: This is a small neighborhood hold out that is consistently busy.  In fact, I thought that that food at this location was much better than their location on Roosevelt Rd.  Service was like a well oiled machine. I really enjoyed their "caldos".  This past Sunday, I tried the Caldo de Pescado, and it was terrific.  Beautiful pieces of what I thought was cod ( the waiter told me it was catfish....but I think he was incorrect....way too flaky and lacked that "muddy" flavor that even farmed catfish has.)  In any event, I will drive from the north side to eat here again.

17.description: Very delicious, found out about this from word of mouth. Even better, they had hand-made tortillas. Very great definitely will be visiting again. My only constructive criticism is that the booths are too close to each other, so the people behind me moved a lot and therefore moved me, that was very annoying.

10.description: hell yeah carne india con hongos is the shiiiiit really good best mexican restaurant in chicago hands down ive had carne con queso y rajas is good too tortas are the best tacos are good also chilaquiles are really good highly recommend this spot
