11.description: I love it here. It's my favorite mexican resturant from the south side of Chicago. There dinner plates are delicious. And service is great.

26.description: A few years back, before the remodeling my mom and I would go here for breakfast all the time. The food was delicious, the coffee strong and not watered down and service great. I went back recently and saw the change and was disappointed. The remodel was nice but now the prices went up and the quality of food suffered. The bf and I went on a busy night but it still took bout 20 minutes before a waitress gave us a menu, about a 1/2 hour before she took our order and then another 1/2 hour waiting for the food. I'm very disappointed and will not be returning. Just proof that smaller is better.

27.description: I had a nice lunch here in the middle of my work day. There was a serious crowd so I took that as a good sign. Service didn't really suffer, though, it was fast and friendly. The salsa was really good, and the roja was served hot. I had ceviche tostadas de camaron, and they were tasty. Next time I'm trying their huaracha and something from the juice bar.

0.description: I used to go there every day when I lived close to that place.The food is delicious, service is very good, the place is clean.It is kind of pricy, but i think it is worth pay for it.I recommend it to all my friends.

20.description: Very delicious, found out about this from word of mouth. Even better, they had hand-made tortillas. Very great definitely will be visiting again. My only constructive criticism is that the booths are too close to each other, so the people behind me moved a lot and therefore moved me, that was very annoying.

19.description: Food was better and their plates were pretty well served but now they have gone cheap on portion sizes oh and a can of coke cost 1.99??? Get out of here! Sad to see this place overcharge on coke and skin on the portion sizes

2.description: I never leave reviews like this unless i really think it's what the place deserves. The customer service here is horrible. The waitress was ignorant when we asked her what type of tacos they have. To top it off she elbowed my shoulder and never said sorry AND dropped a fork on my arm when picking up the plates and never said sorry for that either. Who does that?! When customer service is bad a restaurant doesn't deserve nothing more than a star or even less!

18.description: One thing I like you don't see much at Mexican restaurants is that they have homemade tortillas. I wasn't impressed with the steak they serve on there tacos burritos etc. But when I complained about it they where more and willing to exchange the steak for some other meat. I then order the pork el pastor and was it delicious! I like to go back try another dish. Another thing I really enjoyed was was there margarita's they know how to make one and it isn't watered down it made just right!

13.description: I don't really understand the hype about this place. Personally I've been there 3 times and there is nothing that stands out in my mind. The 1st time I got some shrimp as I am a huge fan of them, not worth the money spent. 2nd time was with my husband and he ordered chilaquiles I got a steak burrito. Again not really impressed as the meat was over seasoned and the beans were from a can. I'm sorry but being Mexican I expect beans from scratch. I decided to give it one more try and ordered a dish called mar y Tierra and once again i was disappointed. It was a small portion for the 15$ I was paying and the fish was bland. Overall not happy with the taste. The service was ok but nothing to brag about.

4.description: Not that great..usual medium of road Mexican cuisine. .service  was abrupt and hurried. The food was barely ok. We started with the  shrimp ceviche tostadas, diced shrimp mixed with red onions and cilantro on a stale tostada, lacked flavor .I  ordered arrechera something toped with cheese .I asked for it rare but as expected it was overcooked. It came with the usual rice and beans combination. Just ok. My wife ordered a chicken and grilled steak combination. .severely over cooked.The chicken was dry and chewy. .the steak was beyond  shoe leather. .she barely ate it..never once did the server ask how our food was! Going forward maybe this experience will make us demand for better service and food.

24.description: Good service, I felt the food was okay.

6.description: Awesome goat soup. Great staff (Carolina is very kind waitress). Gracias por todo. I will definitely return.

22.description: AWESOME!!!! I love the tortilla soup. I have never had anything bad from this place. tostadas, torta, horchata, tacos, enchilidas, everything is great, great, great. Inexpensive, fast, friendly service. I have come here for lunch, dinner, a quick snack. I am never disappointed,

15.description: Went here on a slow day, service was good. The food was alright, I guess we went on a bad day.

7.description: Expensive and flavorless sums up this restaurant. Four tortas and a taco diner and four cans of pop was 50 bucks.

8.description: The food is delicious and the service is magnificent. I highly second this place and the orchata is really good.

30.description: What can I say?  It's GOOD.Good, clean restaurant with tasty food, decent service, and good salsa.  They have a small lot so street parking may be better if you're worried about too many cars backing in/out at the same time.I don't come here too often because I'm literally surrounded by quicker options but I've never had a complaint about the food.  I've tried: "huevos a la Mexicana, cessina, tacos," and some other dishes but it's always been good.  The food's not greasy, the salsa's tasty, the service is polite, digital jukebox, all around good.  Wish I could give more on the intricacies of the food and how the flavor strikes your palate but I'm writing this on memory.Been there off and on for the past 3 years, very consistent.  Definitely a sit-down kind of place.  Groups can be accommodated but only 2 at a time I think so you should call ahead for that.  Oh yeah!  And they take plastic!!  In this neighborhood, that's tough.

3.description: Homemade corn tortillas. Portions are okay. Shrimp soup is good but wish the shrimps were devined. Made the soup a bit "grainy" when eating the shrimp.  The fish was seasoned well. During rush hour, long wait. The steak tacos are a bit dry but good. Complimentary salsa is great and warm when served.

14.description: I was surprised when I went to write a review  because I thought this place would have more stars! If there were more reviews it would have more stars I'm sure because this place is amazing! We have only been there for breakfast but the dinner menu looks delicious, too. Not your run-of-the-mill Mexican food. Lots of interesting combinations. Their tortillas are homemade and delicious, and their salsa is served piping hot. They also have fresh juices and coffee with a slight cinnamon flavor. The breakfast prices are great. This time we didn't have to wait for our check, which we like, but usually they do try to give you your time to relax so they don't hurry with the check (as with many Mexican restaurants).

0.description: Awesome menudo here, folks! They put maiz in it as well. I usually come here for my menudo fix or hangovers in the weekend morning. They deep fry dry hot peppers and serve them with some salt sprinkled over them. They are very crunchy and good to take bites out of with every sip of menudo. But of course, only eat them if you like spicy food. I tend to enjoy the short 10 seconds of pain after every bite.

3.description: Great quesadillas de cuitlacoche and an amazing ATOLE DE MANGO!   I am an atole hater, but this was fantastic.  Keep it up!

1.description: My family lives close and we are always searching for great food, who isn't? We have been wanting to try this place for a while, here are my thoughts.Food- it was good, hot & fast. Service- very nice!Ambiance- eh, the restaurant is a true hole in the wall, ants all over our table because of the sugar dispenser. Will we eat here again, yes- but it would be take out only.

2.description: This is the place if you want a taquiza. The tacos are good and the price even better. The owner is always there and hooks it up. Once we waited extra and it wasn't even that long and she gave us extra drinks for our time. I haven't had a bad meal yet. I feel like I'm at home when I come and the food had the same feel. The tacos de a pastor are the bomb and Asada good too. I had a huaraches once and it was huge, cheap, delicious. Very good place a must try!

0.description: Love this place, my family and I always feel so welcome here.. But the food is so good especially the huraches and the quesadillas.. The owners are very friendly and attentive to all your needs and alway accommodate anything you might need.. I sometimes get stuff that is not on the menu and they do it with no problem, they also sell this buñuelos that are in a bag next to the register and they are the BOMB and they are only $2 for 3... If you are in the area just give it a try you will definitely not be disappointed.

1.description: $2.98 for 24 ounces of fresh blueberries on the last day of January?!I sometimes get lucky and am invited to ride out here from Hyde Park with a friend who is a serious cook and hates spending money unnecessarily.  As he points out, they treat their produce with respect: it's always fresh, and is displayed and handled intelligently.  And man is there a lot of variety.  Something else he pointed out is that they often have amazing sales on fresh fruit in the middle of winter.  As in the above blueberry deal.  I blocked the aisle, without being an especially broad person, as I stared incredulously at the price and quality before gathering half a dozen cartons to scarf, freeze or give to friends.  Well, maybe my big cart and I didn't actually block the aisle, because the aisles are wide (and clean), and even when it's busy it's never crowded like the best places on Devon Avenue can become.  I don't buy meat, but my friend says it's half the price of the stuff at Treasure Island, and just as good quality if not better.  One measure of how fresh the produce is: the cilantro is still fresh five days after purchase--no need to arrange your life around making a salsa within 24 hours of getting it home.The staff are very polite and helpful.  Parking was not a problem.  The mall-y atmosphere of Kedzie Avenue around there is kind of depressing, but so what if it isn't a movie set.  Bring a car or a pack animal, because it is impossible not to leave with about eight bags of good stuff (for under $50).Speaking of places between Pete's Market and Hyde Park that SHOULD be movie sets:  does anyone know anything about the second-hand store next to the gas station on the northwest corner of Garfield and Justine that has "One Man's Treasure" and, even more intriguingly, "The Ambrosia Room" painted in old-school style in green on the side of the brick building?  Near a cheerful, tropical green-painted old bay window at the second-floor level?  We stopped to buy gas and I would have checked it out but it was closed.

0.description: Well, simply the best. I have been coming to this store for over 10 years, and even tough I tried other stores I always come back here. The produce is just very fresh, with a lot of items from all Latin America that you won't find in many places in Chicago. The prices are just about right.  The staff are fast and helpful, and the place is super clean.

12.description: Chicken and potato flautas are so good! Comes with two different sauces and sour cream. Mashed potatoes are good as well and come in different portions. One thing I didn't like about my visit (which has happened twice already) is that I placed an order for pickup. Waited then came in to find out my order ticket was still there with no one working in it. Didn't wait that long but that was the point of me calling it in. Place is pretty small and can get pretty crowded.

3.description: Pollos asados a la parilla!!!Yet another grilled chicken review. The place is nestled right in between a subway restaurant and a currency exchange. It is a small place but always clean.  The service is always nice and fast. The place is kinda small with some bars against the wall where you can eat. I usually take it to go. Chicken is grilled and good in flavor. Sides are good and limited but go well with the chicken. They do have grilled onion and jalapenos. They also have flautas that are ok.Usual drink menu.Not a destination, but if the hood and hungry this is a cool place to have a bite.

1.description: Excellent place for char grilled chicken. Fast service with quality eats. The chicken was cooked well and was seasoned with a slight spiciness to it. There is only a small counter to stand at and eat. It serves it's purpose for a quick meal though. The tortillas were good as well as the beans. They keep the line moving here. You can tell it's a favorite neighborhood spot.

2.description: The food is delicious.  The best guac for $3.50; u will love it.  I'm normally not a fan of refried beans but theirs is delish.  The rice is fluffy and authentic tasting.  The cole slaw is delicious.   The only prob I have is they always speak Spanish to me.  Even though I'm not, they declare I am.  The curse for being racially mixed.  I strongly recommend them.

9.description: My first time here. Great food and service. The chicken was delicious. Reasonable prices and the strawberries and cream where so delicious. Will be going back for sure.

10.description: This place is one of the "RARE" finds  you will ever have the pleasure of Enjoying on 55th and California Ave.. I was absolutely taken back at how "GOOD" their chicken is! When you combine the chicken, tortillas, beans and rice into a hand made taco and top it off with their 5 star grilled onions and jalapenos......Man -O- Man look out! It's a party that will rock your taste buds!

13.description: Clean cheap, Good!!!  What more can you ask for? Chicken is AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!! Must stop inn!

16.description: I'll keep this review nice and short. This place has good chicken and some of the best Cajun fries out there! Even when I'm not hungry and want a snack, I stop in and get some fries. I would highly recommend this place!

6.description: Good food and good service.  Parking on the side. Sometimes you get free flautas.  So this place is good in my book! I havent been disappointed yet.  Nothing else to say .

15.description: Delicious chicken. Don't forget the grilled onions and peppers.

0.description: Love this place!!!! Great food!!!! Specially their chicken !!!  Also quick delivery!!!!

5.description: This is by far the best Resturant in this area.I have been her several times when working is this location am at today.

11.description: Wow I just had this chicken. My father brought some home.  We would always eat from el chisme and pollo feliz but wow! This chicken is awesome. Perfect tender taste! Rice is awesome and the salsa is smooth! My new favorite chicken!!

8.description: If you are looking for quick good chicken near by, look no further. The fries are great as are the chicken flautas. It is my go to fast dinner for the family.

4.description: We always order our chicken here and it's amaZing. A whole chicken meal comes with rice, beans and tortillas. The horchata is very flavorful and rich, ohhhh don't forget to order the strawberries with cream, they are just delicious. The workers will welcome you with a smile and they are very friendly

14.description: Even as you drive by 55th & California, roll your window and smell !  That alone will be enough to awaken all sorts of hunger and so then just pull into the parking lot and run into the PALENQUE Restaurant! They also have a daily special where you can have some delicious char-grilled chicken with a variety of Mexican-style recipes.  Make sure to include get some grilled onions & peppers! Enjoy!!!

7.description: Great tasting chicken. Loved the fresas con crema.. Delivery was prompt and food was nice and hot!

3.description: Best popusas ive tasten..they also deliver to your house with a nice colorful easter basket...i had the frijoles popusas and the assortment of tacos..which were random tacos of potato, beans, some carne roja, and chorizo with potatoes...never visited the place, but my family always orders for deliveryVery authenthic and tasty

1.description: I'm all about those pork and cheese pupusas. They take credit cards and have very good service. Their regular tacos are also fantastic.

2.description: If your looking for tacos de canasta and pupusas....don't come here! Thier tacos de canasta are just tacos pan fried with oil and anyone who has had real ones know that's that's not it. Also, thier pupusas are large gorditas and thier huraches are huge sopes. Thier whole menu is a lie. Don't waste the trip and your money. Icing in the cake......service sucks.

0.description: I was watching a show on The Food Network and the Chef called his creation a "papusa". Looked like something I would love to try so I quickly Yelped "papusas near me", loaded my sister and the dog into my RAV4 and headed off to El Conde S.A. I ordered the chicharron and queso papusas (2 for $5!) and was able to watch them being made. Everyone was very welcoming and kept us company while our papusas were being cooked. I couldn't be more pleased with my meal! The papusas were griddled masa pancakes filled with pork, cheese and beans, served hot and with a really flavorful hot sauce. If you watched the same cooking show I did, make a point out of visiting El Conde S.A. to sample their food. I was not disappointed!

4.description: Knock, knock, whose there? Pupusas! Tacos de canasta..... Not so much. The waitress was nice and friendly, made sure to check up on it. Prices weren't horrible, although they ran out of Horchata. 3/5

3.description: I like this store, it's huge and I always find something good here. The best part is the nice older women behind the counter. They actually show you things! You don't have to stand there and wait forever for someone to wander over.There are tons of clothes, shoes and toys. I've got some great stuff here.

1.description: I think yelpers should give this location more credit, at least better than 2.5 star-rating.  Don't be that harsh.  This one has dressing rooms, by the registers.  I didn't actually see anyone use them, but I had to assume those are there for customers' convenience.  I've not seen any other Unique locations that provide dressing rooms onsite.  This Unique is very spacious.  I wouldn't say this one has the best inventory, but what I saw was not shabby.  I saw some Chicago Cubs scarves that I always wanted (who would pay $40 for a scarf at a souvenir shop?  You tell me), but the stitches were coming undone.  My principle for thrift shopping: if it's not in a "ready-to-wear" condition, forget about it.  In other words, I'm not going to spend extra time to fix it, strengthen it, or alter it.  I found a genuine-leather Dennis Basso jacket for $15 with the half-Monday deal.  He sells his faux-fur/faux-leather line on QVC.  I did some research before purchasing it, and I concluded that it was a good deal to get this at $15.  I know I usually stick to under $5 for one (1) garment, but I think I would splurge a little tonight.  My friend who joined my thrift-shopping trip found the Twlight book, another book she likes, and a limited-edition antique plate.  She went on Google and eBay to find out the market price for the antique place.  She paid $4 for a plate that can potentially be sold for $80!  That plate was cute, and the painting was well-done.  We found no chips or scratches. Here's another rule of thrift-shopping: inspect EVERYTHING and generate a thorough evaluation to see if the deal is worth it.  If not, put it down and move on!  This one is located north of CTA Kedzie Orange line station, in the Gage Park neighborhood.  Technically, it's at the same shopping plaza with T.J. Maxx, but you won't be able to see it coming from the south, just FYI.  There's a plenty of parking spots available.  Nevertheless, there was a construction with a partial road closure.  We couldn't come to Kedzie from the 47th St., so we parked on the vehicle at the plaza where the pregnancy testing center is located and walked north for five (5) minutes on Kedzie.  Hopefully the construction will finish quickly enough so that it doesn't deter your opportunity for coming to this Unique.

2.description: I still go here, but the last time I was here there was a pick pocketer on the loose. Someone has their purse stolen. No one called the police. They just made an announcement that there was a pick pocketer in the store...thank you for the heads up, but what about that poor person who had their purse stolen? Idk, I wouldn't come here and leave my bag in the cart without supervision. I actually have a special way I carry my money with me at thrift stores for this reason. I wear a coat and it has an interior pocket. I just put my wallet in there...that way there is no way it could get stolen. Besides that, I notice a lot of the employee's are less than delightful and swear in front of customers. I don't get offended by swearing or foul language, but I do think there is absolutely no place for that while at work. Talk like that in your personal time...god knows I do Lol

9.description: This Unique is easily twice the size of the one on archer, but on half-off monday please expect it to be twice as crazy with twice as many children jumping out of twice as many clothing racks as they play twice as many games of hide 'n' seek while riding twice as many bicycles in the store.  Accordingly, the employees make four times as many announcements chastizing the parents to watch their children.  But damn cuz........ the parents are busy with all these deals!   Huge selection of clothing, shoes and bric-a-brac.  Jewely counter is somewhat better attending to than most and I've never had to wait more than five minutes to get a checked bag returned (okay, that should be unacceptable, but I've waited damn near 10 minutes at other thrift stores).  I used to believe that the bicycle selection was substantially better at this unique.  If I still felt this way I would add a star, but I don't.  Lately they still have more bikes, but they're usually strictly huffy or department store brand which are a pain to repair.   Otherwise, it's three stars all the way---- four for fellow thrift fanatics.

10.description: I'm a regular thrifter; I'll toddle into a store maybe once or twice a week and check out the wares. I rarely go to this one because despite its size, it is perennially disappointing. It's well organized, I'll give them that, but well-organized crap is still, well, crap. I never find anything well-made here, just a bunch of schmatty, dated polyester clothing. One upside is that they have a relatively large section of children's clothing, so if you're in the market for that you may find something decent. But like all Uniques their pricing is uppity.

4.description: I have been to this location several times and every time I never leave feeling disappointed. The selection is pretty great, from jackets to blouses to skirts, etc.. My favorite item to stock up on here is their pajama pants (I work from home and live in them!). The prices are pretty fair, much less expensive than Goodwill or other consignment shops in my area. The clothes are well organized by color, though if things were organized by size it would be much easier to get in and out of this store in a decent amount of time. It's wise to come here without the expectation that you can find exactly what you're looking for because in truth it's much more of a hunt and search than a pinpointed search and find. Every time I have been in the store, someone is around sweeping away all the garbage on the ground. Despite that, the store is still dusty (my allergies act up if I'm in the store too long), but for the most part things are relatively clean. However, I rarely see clothes lying around on the floor. The staff come around pretty often to keep everything in order, which I appreciate. Above each aisle/rack of clothes are random household items like frames, puzzles, candle holders, etc.. This is another nod to the hunt and peck sort of searching I mentioned above. The books are well stocked and organized, and as you can imagine, very reasonably priced ($.039 for paperback books!). I appreciate the care the put in to making sure cruddy, old, torn apart books aren't in circulation here. In fact, this trip I came out with an assortment of about 6-7 books all in excellent condition, some that even look almost brand new! The only bummer about my most recent trip in is that they would not honor the $10 off $25 without a printed coupon (I had it on my phone, but the manager wouldn't allow that form of redemption). The big bonus is that they have a fair amount of sale days and I believe on Mondays you can get 50% everything in the store! I will be back!

6.description: I went on a Monday when it was 50% off. It is big, but pretty messy. Quite a few items on the floor and it had a weird smell in there.

11.description: I've found many great shirts here. Good brands like ae old nav amer outt hm wet seal and you might stumble upon a shirt still with the tag even. But I agree that the store gets crazy with ppl and their kids on mondays but  it is half price and you gotta be there early to get good stuff.

5.description: I called 4 Unique Thrift Stores, asking them which Unique is the largest. 3 out of 4 replied with ' the one on Kedzie.' The 4th one said she didn't know, and didn't have any one to ask. This is a huge place! Everything was organized by dept, but SO disappointing in the clothes department; NOTHING is organized by SIZE. I mean come on!...they could sell a  whole lot more, if they put it by size. I was lucky, because they did have a Plus size section-so then I only had to go thru about 4 sizes (1x-4x), rather than 12 sizes (0-14). I had a $10 off of $25 coupon (that had been given out at all stores the week before). Pros: 1) shopping mall parking lot- lots of available spots2) LARGE store-the biggest apparently3) clean building with pleasant workers4) prices were great- I got a LS pretty shirt for $2.995) Coupons/Daily dealsCons: 1) NO Sizing on baby/kids/mens/women's/shoes -how can anyone shop this way? How time consuming!2) not many household items for sale3) Dressing rooms (4) had no hooks to hang your clothes on

7.description: I totally went back here despite the bad experience, and ~lo and behold~, the tank top I mentioned in my previous review? I told the manager then that it was worth $3 at best. And there it is, on the rack, two weeks later, and priced at $2.99.I bought it, but seriously, is the manager that much of a sexist to wait until I leave to price it fairly? Who did that benefit? Certainly not the store! It sat there for two weeks! Surprise, surprise, I'm the only customer who was even remotely interested in the top, and if I hadn't come back, dude would have lost that money forever. At least I ended up paying what it was worth, not the generous $8 manager special.

8.description: Never ever shop here unless someone has pointed a gun to your head. This store has a big sign that now deems the Unique as 'Your department thrift store.' Um, that is a contradiction in terms. The prices now reflect the fact they deem themselves a 'department' store. The prices made me more than once scream out, 'are you crazy?' and 'stop smoking crack.' I think most of the other shoppers in the store thought I was a little bonkers but....the only thing that was crazy was expecting me to pay 25 bucks for a decade old suit that had orange stains on it. I would not even waste my time on this store for the famous half-off Mondays. If you enjoy paying real department store prices for thrift store crap then please shop here. Otherwise, avoid like it has the swine flu.

0.description: I would argue that the reviewers from the suburbs (especially the one who calls the pricer a crack smoker), are probably looking for a vintage clothing store and not a thrift. Best Unique in the city. Just make sure you can go on a sale day.I also would wonder how familiar the reviewer below is with the CPD? If you called the police to a Southwest Side thrift store the perps would be in Memphis by the time a cop showed up.

1.description: My husband & I were married at River Roast this past Labor Day weekend. We selected Kloeckner after meeting with Mark because we were so impressed with his level of experience, familiarity with our venue, wonderful demeanor, & the value of the flowers & services he was offering. Kloeckner did not disappoint. The flowers were all delivered promptly & were absolutely beautiful. Our ceremony & reception spaces were completely transformed & just breathtaking. Mark & Pam were a pleasure to work with and I would recommend them in a heartbeat. They are very knowledgeable & their work is amazing & all for a reasonable price. Call them now.

9.description: We work with Kloeckner all the time at work so when it was time to get married, we knew we wanted to have them do the flowers. They came out so beautiful! We met with Mark once and showed him a couple ideas- the flowers were beyond beautiful for our June 14th wedding. They also organized all the votives, set up, flip and breakdown. I never saw them the day of the wedding to even thank them. What a professional company that is the best at what they do. Thank you!

23.description: Kloeckner was our florist for our July 2008 wedding.  We were extremely happy with our wedding flowers and highly recommend them to anyone.  Kloeckner has a small, family run, feel to the business and the service was very personalized.  The flowers turned out beautifully and they completely understood the look I was going for.  No complaints!

12.description: I used Kloeckner for my wedding in September, and overall I am happy with the results. The flowers turned out beautifully, if not 100% what I expected. The prices were also extremely reasonable, compared to the ridiculous mark-up that many places charge closer to downtown. I would advise brides to put up with the annoying drive to use Kloeckner, because it is definitely worth it. One star deducted just because Mark is a little disorganized. I would have to request changes to the proposal 2-3 times before they were implemented. I think he would benefit from hiring an intern to help with the logistics of wedding flowers.

21.description: Like Edwina, Blue Plate recommended Kloeckner for our August 2009 wedding and I couldn't have been happier. Unlike some of the other florists I visited, Mark navigated me through the process without overwhelming me with ideas too grand for my budget. We kept it simple, which is what I wanted. And it was by far the most reasonable estimate I received. As you can see from the picture, I was truly overwhelmed when the flowers showed up on my big day. I can't praise them enough.

16.description: Kloeckner blew us away and exceeded all expectations for our September 17 wedding.  Mark and his team are consummate professionals, execute perfectly and provide superior creative direction.From the start, Mark was patient and listened to our somewhat vague ideas, showed us examples and pictures and took our venue (huge, high ceilings) into account when creating the proposal.  He was all about having fun with the designs and mixing things up but still provided us with a lot of practical guidance.No detail was too small - at one point a small component of one of the centerpieces had to be changed to comply with fire code - though I am sure I would not have noticed, Mark made sure I was aware of and ok with the change prior to making it.  The team was also flexible - when we had a last minute change in our table count, the team worked with us and provided seamless solutions.  As our guests' pictures appear on facebook and the like, we can't help but notice how all of them have multiple shots of the flowers - even the guys snapped pictures - they were that gorgeous. Mark knows the city and its venues so well - I would recommend Kloeckner for any floral occasion.Thank you!!

17.description: I worked with Mark for my October 2013 wedding at Cafe Brauer and he completely exceeded my expectations.  Cafe Brauer is such beautiful space as is, I didn't want flowers to be over powering or loud.  I wanted romantic and classic.  He nailed it with both the flowers and candles.  He was very flexible with budget as well.  He was able to create our vision while staying in our budget.  Which is very important when planning a wedding in Chicago.  I'm waiting on pictures from my photographer and will upload when I receive!  Highly, highly recommend!

10.description: Mark really knows his stuff and is very talented at what he does.  He knew my venue (The Murphy) very well and was great at making good suggestions while also incorporating everything my husband and I had envisioned for our wedding.  Awesome vendor!

5.description: LOVED LOVED LOVED Everything about working with Mark and Pam for flowers for our Chicago wedding on October 10th!! They did an absolute amazing job, totally hit it out of the park.  The personal flowers, centerpieces, cake flowers, everything was absolutely stunning.  Mark made the process so easy, I don't know a lot about flowers but I knew the colors/style I was looking for and he brought it to life perfectly.  He definitely had our best interest in mind and wasn't looking to give you the it's a wedding let's double the price mark up a lot of vendors do.  He was very reasonable and focused on high quality flowers which looked absolutely stunning.  Kloeckner absolutely knocked it out of the park and I would highly recommend them to anyone and will certainly use them again for any future floral needs.   Mark really knows his stuff and was there every step of the way to make sure I was comfortable with every decision and he definitely helped guide me to make sure my vision became a reality.  I cannot thank you and your team enough!!!! Job well done.

11.description: The flowers for our wedding, which took place at "The Murphy" on Oct 2012, were exquisite.  Mark was highly recommended by the venue as well as the catering company.  I explained to him what I envisioned, and I promptly received a proposal reflecting exactly what I had requested.  The flowers were gorgeous and so gracefully arranged; it was hard to believe all this was within my budget.  I feel very fortunate to have had such beautiful flowers at our wedding.  Thank you Kloeckner Preferred Flowers!

22.description: This is my hidden gem - they were recommended to me by someone at Blue Plate Catering, after he had realized I was a budget bride telling me that Mark at Kloeckner was really good at making things work with smaller budgets.  They are on the trusted vendor list at one of the most expensive Chicago wedding locations, Cafe Brauer so I knew that this wasn't a second rate florist.  I didn't sign with Blue Plate for my catering (I'm small potatoes) but I am so thankful to Blue Plate for recommending Kloeckner.  They provided the flowers and centerpieces for our wedding last week and I could not be happier!One, their prices were unbeatable - even my DOC said his contacts couldn't be as cost competitive.  The flowers were gorgeous and totally tied my wedding together thematically.  I didn't have a big floral budget but Mark made it work!  It was perfect!Mark was also great with customer service - when I requested a sample of a centerpiece to take to our rental company and look at our sample dining table, I was able to go to his shop and pick it up.  He was also very flexible with changes to the contract.  Again, recommend highly!

0.description: We had my daughter's wedding at Cafe Brauer. Many vendors on their preferred list were extremely expensive. We wanted beautiful flowers but did not feel we had to overly spend. We had a decent size wedding of 220. Also, wanted a beautiful chuppah. We worked with Mark on the chuppah, high/low flowers for tables and daughters' /bridesmaids bouquets. Mark Weber was excellent! Received numerous compliments on gorgeous Flowers! DO NOT HESITATE!

20.description: Kloeckner's did our flowers for our December 2007 wedding and they were just gorgeous. My bouquet stayed gorgeous for days afterwards, which was amazing.Their prices are unbeatable, which was fabulous. We didn't have a huge budget to spend on flowers and everything that was created was just lovely. Mary was lovely to work with and was great to contact via email. She always responded right away and kept our files nice and updated.They've also been a holdout in the Gage Park area. Most businesses up and left when the neighborhood gentrified, but they've stayed and they have a great working relationship with a lot of churches, businesses, and families.Delivery is great and on time--always! For our wedding and for all the flowers I've had delivered in the past, they show up when they're supposed to, if not earlier.My only complaint is that it was a little tough to get in touch with people by phone, but had I not been planning a wedding and in snowbeast hell, I wouldn't have found this to be as much of an issue. I'd still go to Kloeckner's before anyone else.

19.description: This is my hidden gem - they were recommended to me by someone at Blue Plate Catering, after he had realized I was a budget bride telling me that Mark at Kloeckner was really good at making things work with smaller budgets.  They are on the trusted vendor list at one of the most expensive Chicago wedding locations, Cafe Brauer so I knew that this wasn't a second rate florist.  I didn't sign with Blue Plate for my catering (I'm small potatoes) but I am so thankful to Blue Plate for recommending Kloeckner.  They provided the flowers and centerpieces for our wedding last week and I could not be happier!One, their prices were unbeatable - even my DOC said his contacts couldn't be as cost competitive.  The flowers were gorgeous and totally tied my wedding together thematically.  I didn't have a big floral budget but Mark made it work!  It was perfect!Mark was also great with customer service - when I requested a sample of a centerpiece to take to our rental company and look at our sample dining table, I was able to go to his shop and pick it up.  He was also very flexible with changes to the contract.  Again, recommend highly!

2.description: Mark & Pam with Kloeckner Flowers were one of the best choices we made for our wedding. I was getting married at the Murphy Auditorium, and everyone I talked to recommended calling Mark before talking to anyone else. Mark helped me organize my thoughts about what I wanted for the bouquets and vision for the ceremony & reception. He helped me make decisions about the lay-out for the room and advised items to incorporate or avoid based on his understanding of the venue. While I liked them during the planning process, I was blown away by how beautiful the flowers turned out! My bouquet was even more beautiful than I imagined, and the colors for the bouquet and ceremony/reception centerpieces were absolutely perfect. With competitive pricing and absolutely gorgeous work, it is worth venturing outside of the city for the fantastic customer service & work!

18.description: All i can say is that I wish Mark had taken the time to make my Valentine's arrangement as what I received was the absolute WORSE!!  My husband ordered an arrangement off the FTD site and sent them to me as we are from out of town, staying in the Chicago area.   Upon receiving it I wanted to cry and even the front desk manager couldn't believe the poor quality.  We called Kloeckner expressing our displeasure and disbelief so they call FTD to make a new delivery for the next day to replace this one.  It looked little better and was just overall awful.  I don't know if the mix up is through FTD or Kloeckner but whichever I can't believe a successful florist would put their name on this.  Shame on you both!!!

13.description: I worked with Mark for my wedding this past weekend, October 5, 2013, and I can't describe how wonderful everything was. The flowers were fresh, beautiful, and put together well. I was most nervous about my bouquet, and when I showed up it took my breath away. It literally brought my mom to tears. It's been two days and it's actually still going strong. I highly recommend Kloeckner! They were very reasonably priced as well! Thank you for making my wedding beautiful!

4.description: I ordered some flowers over the phone for one our clients and Irene took my order.Awesome customer service and easy phone order, very impressed!

24.description: I had to order flowers at the last minute, and they had a great website, something many flower shops are lacking. I found them online and since it was for a customer, I picked something local - HOPING they could possibly deliver the same day to my account. WHICH they accomodated!!! :)) Also, they were sooooo helpful over the phone, very descriptive about exactly what I was getting. Extremely pleasant on the phone and patient, cuz I am sure I was being a PIA....  I would have given them 5 stars, but I haven't been in there personally. But definitely very helpful over the phone, and the web site was great!

6.description: I called from out of town at 9 am hoping to have flowers delivered to my daughter later today or even tomorrow. I know they are busy due to Mother's Day. Instead, Arlene took my order, helped me with choices of flowers and within the hour the most glorious vase of sunflowers and hydrangeas were delivered to her.  That is customer service. My highest recommendation.

15.description: My family has been ordering floral arrangements from Kloeckner's for almost 25 years. We've always had exceptional customer service and gorgeous floral pieces. We often find guests/friends asking "Did you get the flowers from Kloeckner's?" Then following the question with a statement such as: "Wow they are gorgeous." Q: What makes this florist so great? A: The floral designers!! The designers at Kloeckner's are not afraid to be creative and use modern techniques to achieve a desired outcome. Kloeckner's did the flowers for our wedding in February 2009. Everything was gorgeous!! I was extremely happy when the bridal flowers arrived at our hotel room ... on time and beautiful. The flowers really completed the look. Another happy part of the day was when we walked into our reception hall to see two different centerpieces (one high; one low) with the most gorgeous colors and mixture of flowers. Just perfect!! We worked with the owner, Mark, and he was extremely accommodating and helpful. Mark did a great job of recommending various types of flowers and/or containers due to the theme of our wedding and the time of year. We took his advice and couldn't be happier with the outcome!! Mark was also very easy to communicate with via telephone and email.

7.description: We worked with the Kloeckner team - Mark and Pam - for our wedding at Architectural Artifacts in February 2015 and would highly recommend them to others.In the scheme of things, I didn't want to spend a lot of money on flowers and wasn't looking for anything super elaborate.  I just wanted a minimalist but classical look and Mark was extremely helpful in providing suggestions for how to bring that to life - and on budget (esp compared to some quotes we got).  In addition, he was able to bring the vision to life beyond just the flowers with candles down the aisle, flowers for the chuppah and votives along entry tables and throughout the venue.And the execution of everything was just perfect.  When we went in to look at the centerpiece mock up a month before, it was exactly what we had discussed and didn't have to change anything.  And the day of the wedding, we got lots of compliments on how beautiful the flowers and bouquets were. I would absolutely work with the team again and recommend them to others.

8.description: My daughter just got married at Cafe Brauer and we used Kloeckner Preferred Flowers for all the bouquets, centerpieces and ceremony flowers.  The place looked stunning!  The flowers were so elegant, just exactly what my daughter wanted.  Mark was so attentive and creative.  He listened to what my daughter wanted and also suggested things she hadn't thought of (candles perched high, illuminating the entire room) .  He is easy going, yet professional. He helped make my daughter's wedding day worry free. Definitely worth the trip to the southwest side.

3.description: My husband and I got married at the Murphy during Memorial Day weekend and used Kloeckner for our floral needs. Mark was a pleasure to work with and he and his staff were very responsive and had a "can do" attitude. They did an outstanding job the day of the wedding. I wanted to cry when I saw the bouquets...they were perfect! Exactly what I wanted. We received so many compliments on the flowers in the venue as well. Highly recommend Kloeckner for any of your floral needs!!!

14.description: Like Edwina, Blue Plate recommended Kloeckner for our August 2009 wedding and I couldn't have been happier. Unlike some of the other florists I visited, Mark navigated me through the process without overwhelming me with ideas too grand for my budget. We kept it simple, which is what I wanted. And it was by far the most reasonable estimate I received. As you can see from the picture, I was truly overwhelmed when the flowers showed up on my big day. I can't praise them enough.

3.description: Finishing a Torta at this place is akin to a one-night-stand. You had a great time, you're a little ashamed, and you definitely need a shower.For my non-Torta-eating friends, a Torta is the Mexican take on a sandwich. Meat, cheese, toppings, all sandwiched between grilled bread. You can order one at your local Mexican burrito place and it will probably be pretty tasty. Order one at this particular restaurant and it will blow your freaking mind.First, the Tortas here are Torta-zilla in scale. Massive. Think a large loaf of bread sliced in half. While the size will immediately wow you, it's nothing compared to the mind-blow you'll experience when you bite in. Do you like Mexican flavors? Imagine a buttered loaf of fresh bread, stuffed with pork shoulder, Carne Asada, grilled chicken, Chorizo, mango salsa, pineapple, or combinations of your favorite Mexican meats and flavors. Load it with gooey melted cheese, and then grill that bad-boy to crusty-bread perfection. It's Mexican flavor perfection on a roll. The sandwiches are soccer themed, named after famous players. The decor can only be described as no-frills rustic Mexican sandwich shop. Mexican soap operas blare on the TVs. Customers are local teenagers and blue collar workers that just got off shift. The servers all speak Spanish. In other words, amazing. Go get one, wash it down with a Mexican Coke, and relish in the fact that you went here before it was cool.

1.description: Come here if you are starving because the sandwhiches are huge hereVery filling and overwhelming since there are many choices and meat combosI usually order La Memo Ochoa or mega cubanaMy only issue wit this place is that they do not accept credit cards. Its 2016!! Not a big deal theres a walgreens down the street i guess.

2.description: Huge tortas!!I had been stalking this restaurant to open like a lion stalks his prey, for I knew that once they opened there would be a cornivore's feast. I had been to their Cermak location a couple of times and was always pleased with their food.Can you belive that 2 days passed by without me noticing that they had opened. But by the third day I was there ready to try some of their food and of course compare it with the other location and other restaurants around this hood.Tortas Mexico city style, so they say. Huge selection that is for sure. I have been there twice this week and tried a few of their items. First time I was there with a friend and got 2 tortas to share. Memo Ochoa comes with about 7 meats and cheese and pineapple, very good indeed.I also tried the ahogada. Seasoned shredded pork torta smothered in a sweet-spicy sauce that is soo good, I came back and ordered it again. Also tried the Mexican burger with ham and pineapple, solid good.Regular drink menu and great service.DTC, great tortas

5.description: So far so good. Pros:Great valueTortas are hugeCons:Cash onlyTortas come in only one size: hugeMy first time here, should have visited sooner. It's a good stop for tacos & tortas. The place has enough elbow room, the staff is polite, and the tacos are &1.75. Yes please.Looking for a light snack, get some tacos because everything else is super value size. However I had no complaints about the tortillas or the meats. I will come back to try more treats and possibly add another star. Tacos (lomo, cecina):Very good for such a low priceTacos (carne asada):Somehow not as good as others

6.description: This is not your typical torta place.  They have about 50 different tortas and they are huge.  You can probably share one with a friend.  There are so many ingredients that they can put on the tortas such as eggs, hotdogs, milanesa, cheese, ham, peppers, lettuce, tomatoes, pine apple,etc.  The girls at the counter are very nice.  The only two negatives about this place....they only take cash and worse, they don't have a landline telephone.   Dona Torta does business on a flip phone cell phone.  So, if you phone in a order you get a very bad connection, the calls drop or they don't to the phone in time and you get voicemail.  But I still gave them 4 stars because the food is great.  It's just a pain to phone in an order.

7.description: The food here is awesome. Nothing fancy, just real down to earth Mexican TORTAS. The real nitty gritty. Meat, cheese, sour cream and avocado topped with more meat, cheese, sour cream and avocado. Definitely the thing you crave after a late night. Recommended.

0.description: Come here if you are hungryyyyy! Portions size are BIG! Place is clean and bright.Everything we had was pretty good. I had the La Memo Ochoa and thought all those ingredients mixed together would be weird, but it worked. Only thing is, I can do without the hot dogs.  Horchata was nice and tasty.Waitresses didn't really check on us though. I had to go up to ask for water and to get the bill. They were friendly and nice though, just not very attentive.Will definitely be back to check out other items on the menu.

4.description: Worst service ever. I walked in at nine o'clock because the "Open"  sign was on and as we sat down the waitress asked us to get up and order to go, I did because the food is good but the 20 minutes we waited on our food 4 other people still walked in and were told the same and the open sign still on.

3.description: I was skeptical of going to a pawnshop but after my experience here I'm glad I did. I was taken back by their incredible customer service, willingness to get you the most for your items, and very clean store and professional staff. I live all the way in Hyde Park and there are so many pawnshops along the way, but I wouldn't do business anywhere else. The reviews are very true, their customer service can't be beat!

1.description: Came here because I needed to come up with extra cash to pay my college tuition. I was kind of skeptical at first seeing that I had never been to a pawn shop & heard that they can be pretty shady. The manager Ed is very welcoming & really willing to get you the best deal for your items. The entire staff is great! Ed is very sure to explain the process to you & the reason as to why your item is quoted for the price they give you. I went there for a 2nd time & Ed actually greeted me by name which surprised me but made me feel very comfortable. I stay 30 mins away from this location & there's plenty of other pawn shops I bypass driving to this location. However I will never go to another one!

2.description: I'm currently managing this location now,  let us make you a believer of all the great reviews given at my old location on 1441 N. Milwaukee, Put us to the test.....see you soon my Yelpers! """"""{Look at the non recommended reviews as well!}

0.description: I bought a 32" Samsung Smart TV and a pair of ice skates. Excellent customer service and a fun atmosphere. Definitely will shop there again and will recommend.

1.description: Long overdue.This is my panaderia of choice. They have everything you would expect from a Mex panaderia and great prices.I could write and write about what they have but if you have been to a panaderia you know what  I mean, and if you haven't, well check this one out.Service is super nice and super fast. even with some long lines sometimes.

0.description: One of my favorite panaderias here in the city. A great selection. Such a clean place and very organized. Seasonal selection are always available i.e pan de Muerto, roscas. Everything is fresh and their customer service is great. Very friendly people here. Favorite part when I see a fresh batch of bolillos fresh out the oven. Nothing is bad. It is all good.

12.description: Love love love this place. Just moved to the area and after a bad experience at a nearby place we decided to give Waldo's a try. We ordered a pep and jalapeno and it was amazing, service was nice and prompt. This place is definitely a staple on the Southside. Thanks!

3.description: Waldo Waldo WaldoGood pizza, nice service. I have taken to go a few times and is solid good and great prices. Like the 50% off on Tuesdays on pizza.

1.description: The girl at the front counter literally tried to argue with me saying pepperoni wasn't meat.....

2.description: The pizza here is pretty good. The fries are okay and the wings only come in two flavors and are over priced. I've been ordering from here for about 3 months and have not had an issue until recently. The driver for my order comes with one thing out of 3 and took him more than the expected time. Cooneys did give me a credit but then messed up my order when I used the credit. I called yesterday and they weren't offering delivery. Who doesn't offer delivery on a Sunday? They have an online promo which I never get to use because the system says they do not deliver to my home but they do. I have called and complained and they can't do anything or offer me the promo. I ordered a large pizza (which is not that big) with pepperoni n sausage, 12 wings, had to pick it up and paid almost $40. Way over priced for me now. Overall the food is nothing special the pizza is good but for the hassle not sure if it's worth it.

9.description: after waiting 40 mins in the store for my order, the food was terrible. We ordered a bbq sandwitch, a chicken sandwich, a salad, onion rings, ans poppers.About 40 dollars in food it was given to us cold. The bbq did not have bbq sauce on it.Whwn we called to talk to the Manager to explain, He was very rude, ignorant and stupid. If it was the Manager. We told him that we did not want our money back but only replacement sandwiches. We told him that we were customers at least once a month and had the pizza, catering, and other food, He would not help us and said SO WHAT if we did not like what we got..not good customer service. I did not know that business was that good at this time.Well my business and that of ten of our friends will not be buying from you again since you do not need us. Maybe a few more people will stop buying and we wlll see what SO WHAT means.  It is a shame when a neighborhood closes....SO SAD!!!!!

10.description: The staff was nice enough but the cheese pizza was greasy, doughy and did not taste good at all. .

4.description: The lady who answers the phone is a complete a**hole! She kept cutting me off as I ordered. Then I tried to ask her if it was cheaper to get the special and she acted really annoyed, at the end of my order she just hung up the phone. I called back to cancel my order because I'm not about to give my money to a company that has rude service. Of course  she answered again and all she said was "okay" and hung up! She didn't even take my name down or ask for my card number, that was very unprofessional. When I called back to talk to a manager, he kept acting like he couldn't understand what I was saying. Never ordering from here anymore. it's not my fault you couldn't get a better job

6.description: Tey have some really good pizza. I've been odering from there for many years and never had a complaint.

15.description: I love the pizza and chicken sandwichs... Everything here is good!

0.description: I love the service here! They show up to deliver exactly when they say they will! Better delivery than pizza nova for sure! & the delivery guy is SO NICE!!  the only reason I'm giving this 4 stars is because I've never eaten inside the restaurant but the pizza is good!!

5.description: Never ordering from there again.

13.description: The slice of pizza was acceptable. The service was friendly and fast.

11.description: God, the service is slow.  The pizza is poor.  The Italian beef is 4 on the 20 point scale.

8.description: This place has been around since I can remember. Been a while since I have ordered from them, but decided to order last week after seeing one of their flyers on my gate. Man did I forget what this pizza tasted like. I ordered a family 16'  pepperoni with extra cheese. So damn good. Me and my wife were like WOW after the first bite, even the pizza itself looks like it tasted better than the other places. Blows away the other pizza places around our area. Hands down one of the best pizza places in Chicago.

14.description: I am on a mission to order pizza weekly, and will now rotate my pizza between Falco's and Waldo Cooney's.  Without the cheese, the sauce and crust both have flavor.  The crust has that sort of cornmeal on the bottom, which I like, and some sort of herbs in the sauce (I can't recall what, sorry!).  I have ordered cheeseless mushroom & onion pizza as well as tomato & spinach pizza.  Their spinach is better than Falco's. Service was fine.  I tried calling in the order, but their computers were messed up  (I was paying by credit card).  But lo and behold, they have online ordering!  The pizza came in a little under an hour (as estimated).  So if you want  a change from Falco's, try this place.

7.description: Not ordering from here again. Pizza took almost 2hrs to get to my house. By the time it got here pizza was cold and the fries were also cold. We called to complain and they gave us $5 off our next order but doubt we will be using it.

12.description: "Holy tamale thunder batman!"  they are amazingly good...   Make sure to bring cash because they don't accept debit/credit here.  Did I say that this place is amazing... lol...

3.description: There Tamales Are Great But They Mess Up Your Order A Lot. They Messed Up Mine Because I Had Ordered For Them To Put Me Only Green Tamales, But The Lady Had Put ALL Red Tamales. And I Am Not Going There Anymore

1.description: I recently decided to give this place a second chance since my first experience was not one to male me want to go back. I had family coming in from out of state and wanted some comfort food. Didn't realize it was cash only (my mistake). I only had a few bucks so I went in anyway and got green tamales my personal favorite... Flavor completely changed for the better since the last time I was there. Nice heat factor and no more of that over seasoning.

2.description: It kills me to write this about a place that I loved so much but I just can understand why their food as gone so downhill, I LOVE TAMALES and this was my number one place to go and get them since I moved to the midway area .. But lately they are SO DRY and have no flavor don't know what happened but I am going to have to fine some where else to get my tamales from..

9.description: EWW!!! I go to the Maxwell street market to get tamales Oaxaqueños. They are the best I have ever eaten. Unfortunately for me they only sell them there, and they do not sell them in the winter. So I went on my trusty yelp app and searched for those suckers. I found Rosa's Tamales in gage park. Success!! Or so I thought. We drive there on a Sunday morning and upon entering the restaurant I am already getting an uneasy feeling. The tables and chairs look like victims of a hurricane and the place looks like it could use a good cleaning.We sit down and wait for our waitress, we don't get menus. I had to strain to look through the fog covered window to see the menu on the wall. About 5 minutes later we get our tamales.  We open them up to see that they are still mushy, but the meat is overcooked. The tamales were also very small. We gave them a shot and ate them anyway praying we didn't get sick. My fellow yelpers failed me with this place!

10.description: This joint is exactly that. A true Mexicano knows how to chose a hole in the wall, But the tamales I think are the best in the city. Moist,hot not too much masa. Priced right. Bring cash.  As good as your AMA makes.

13.description: We've been going here for a few years. We always get the Oaxaqueno tamales.Never disappointed. Can't decide if we like the rojas or verde better,  so we get 4 of each. Still hot we get home, have one of each for lunch. A couple days later, we steam up the other 4  for lunch and they are even better.

16.description: This place is amazing. Rosas tamales is delicious. I enjoy eating their tamales rojos Oaxaquenos and their tamales rajas con queso. I like green tamales too but not from here because the chicken is cubed and not shredded. I don't know, I just preffer it shredded. Their champurado , a thick Mexican style hot chocolate, is a cup of heaven. Make sure to bring cash because they don't accept debit/credit here.

6.description: i was recommended this place since I always get Manolo's on 63rd st.First and last time I will get tamales from here. I got two dozens tamales. 1 dz of green chicken 6 red pork, 3 bean and 3 strawberries. The chicken were decent, yet the pork were mysterious...maybe it was this batch. Sauce was ok and lacked meat... the only reason it received two stars was due to the champurrado ...thick and full of flavor..... the place seemed run down. a dark entry feeling.....

15.description: These tamales were amazing!  The oaxacan chicken with green sauce...they are absolutely the best tamales I have ever had!!  just an FYI, this is a cash only place; no debit or credit cards.

0.description: One of few places that I can find the Oaxaqueño's Tamales. I love them and so has everyone that I've given one out two. It can get busy in there and sometimes run out of the queso con rajas,  but if you are patient will have them done in half hour or so.  Take cash, they don't accept debit/credit. There is a BOA across the street.

5.description: Best tamales and oaxaqueños ever. Very few places in this big city has tamales as good as these. The place is just a shack but don't let that fool you. Best to take these to go.

11.description: I gave Rosa's Tamales one more chance to improve on the dry, tasteless dozen I purchased two weeks before.  The meat - and very little of it - was cubed.  Cubed! The second half dozen was no better.   All is not lost.  I recently became aware  that the five star Taco Mex on 108th and Torrence reopened.  The first question I asked was if the same person was making the tamales.  And yes, yes she is.  These wrapped bundles of deliciousness are moist, meat filled wonders.  The rojo are mild  and flavorful.  The verde are tender pork with just the right amount of heat.  If you live in Evanston it is worth the trip.

8.description: This place has out of this world tamales.  Hands down, greatest I have ever had. No frills, place your order and you got em in a minute or two, piping hot fresh out of the pressure cookers lined up behind the counter. Very nice employees.  Grab a bottle of Mexican Coke while waiting from the fridge behind you, they are exactly like I remember Coke as a kid when they still included cane sugar in the ingredients. Might want to also get a squirt bottle of red or green sauce from the fridge, then sit down and enjoy a steaming hot Mexican miracle.  Hmmm, 2nd time this week. I prefer the pork, they offer them made with green or red sauce flavoring. Hot damn they rule my world, love them both.

4.description: After reading the reviews, I expected this place to have delicious tamales. However, the tamales were dry and not tasty at all. Thank god I didn't find a cockroach like another patron did. If you want dry chicken with green sauce tamales then this is the place to go. But if you want delicious chicken verde tamales, go somewhere else. I'm still looking for a good tamale restaurant in this area. So far it seems like only the tamale stands offer good tamales.

14.description: THE best tamales in town!! No fat on the chicken; its nice and shredded, all white meat! Try their green tamales and rajas con queso. Complimented by their agua de horchata and I am set!! Bring cash!! Promise it will be worth it!

7.description: Oaxaquenos!Hands down, my new favorite tamale place. This is a small place that always has a fast moving line. My new love affair is the oaxaquenos, a slightly larger tamale wrapped in a banana leaf. So moist, so flavorful, so good!You can eat inside although there are only approximately 25 seats inside. The staff is friendly and helpful. The regular corn husk tamales are $8.00 per dozen, while the oaxaquenos are $1.50 each.I love the tamales from here!

1.description: Only because I had to give one star. I have been a loyal customer of the little village location since I was a child. I decided to try the kedzie location and was very very dissapointed in taste aside from that my orders were warm smh. 7 tacos a bitter melon juice $30 no thank you.

9.description: Awful, awful, awful!!!  I have ordered Tortillas to be delivered for my business for several years from this company.  Since the beginning, their customer service has been the worst I've seen.  They do not come in a timely manner, nor do they even block a window of time to have the product delivered.  Basically, they come when it is convenient for them, not convenient for my business nor myself in running it.  Recently, they set up a specific day that they will only be in specific areas, I signed up for Friday, which was fine by me.  At least I was getting a day!  But, instead of coming on Friday, they came on Wednesday and then had the audacity to question why I was unavailable to drop everything and allow them to deliver the product.  When I spoke with the driver, he said "why don't you just order from someone else, I'm the boss here, and I can do whatever I want".  I spoke with the supposed manager/owner at the company, and was given a similar response.  It's too bad, I'm happy with the product, but I will never do business with them again.

23.description: their al pastor tacos are the best the rest of the menu is good to ok.But as long as they make that al pastor i will be a fan!

5.description: Not one of my spots to visit. The food is ok if you're getting out of a bar or club and nothing else is opened. Otherwise I wouldn't go. It's cash only which is a huge minus. The best thing they got are probably the licuados (shakes). Place is always full parking lot is small. Usually parking on side streets. Wouldn't miss it if it was gone.

25.description: Delicious shakes, wonderful steak tacos and reasonably priced.  This neighborhood spot is a great find.

12.description: Why are people coming on here to review Tortillas bought at Eurofresh?!!! Nothing to do with this restaurant!!! And then people talking about " The only way to eat tacos is with flour tortillas"!!! Seriously?! Your palette will be happier at "Chipotle" not at an authentic Mexican restaurant.  Atotonilco tacos are delicious and it mostly has to do with the tortillas, they are awesome! The cons is that parking is scarce and they don't take credit cards.

21.description: These are the best al pastor tacos this side of Tijuana. They also have delicious Horchata. The service is top notch.

16.description: Talk about OVERRATED! Well, someone, (namely ME) is finally here to knock this franchise down a few pegs.I ate at the one in Worth off 111th...and since this IS a franchise, one can intelligently assume the food basically tastes the same at all their locations. SInce I ordered 3 different types of tacos there can be NO CONFUSION that this wasnt an off night for them.I ordered 3 tacos on flour (for me, flour is the ONLY way to order a taco....corn overpowers the flavors)Steak, Chicken and the much touted "Al Pastor", ie, marinated pork.Aside from the chicken (which came in chunks instead of shredded and marinated) these were the DRIEST, blandest tasting CRAP tacos Ive ever eaten!The steak and pork were chopped so fine and from being so dry they basically DISINTEGRATED in my mouth as if I were fed sawdust. YUCK. The cheese wasnt even a good mexican crumbly cheese but was the melty no flavor type they use at Pete's Market when ya order their bland stuffed chili relleno.Dont believe the hype about this place folks - I review mexican food SOBER. ;-)

17.description: Best al pastor tacos ever! Love how its cooked with the red sauce and onions, whenever i have a bad day i go here and makes me feel better

10.description: I've been coming to this restaurant since I was a kid. They have the best al pastor tacos there!!!

11.description: Filthy, dirty restaurant. I am calling bd of health. Oh yeah, hair under my tasteless taco. No gloves, no hair nets, Jo chips. And way way too expensive. Taco Bell would be better, cleaner, cheaper. Not even an apology for the hair.....it must be part of the rancid meat. Stay away, so far no diarrhea....what a surprise...!!!!!

26.description: By far, my favorite tacos in the city! The carne asada/biste tacos are delicious. The meat is perfectly cooked! The tortillas are yummy because they're dipped in grease and their licuados (milkshakes) are the perfect accompaniment! I go there once a week!

27.description: ah, here we are. this "restaurant" has only one reason to exist, and that is the Al Pastor tacos. really, with a bit of imagination YOU can make most of the stuff on their menu. and make it better. but the al pastor, ( marinaded pork ) tacos are head and shoulder the best in this state. i will stand behind that statement. unfortunately, i can't say the same about the rest of the menu. only for the hardcore pork enthusiast

0.description: The best tacos outside of Mexico.  Our absolute favorite.  It takes so long to drive here in Chicago traffic but it's worth it.  Ask for the special red salsa they use for the Al Pastor.

20.description: I used live 3 blocks away from that restaurant.  Their torta and chocolate milkshake with cinnamon is delicious!

19.description: Por eso estamos como estamos!!  I've been coming to Atotonilco since I was a little kid myself and now I bring my kid here too. Best alpastor tacos ever! And asada is really good too. I love their salsa and licuados! Now I'm hungry.

2.description: Not as good as the one on 26th St but is there.Huge place, solid pastor tacos and tortas de milanesanot the best place is the hood but they are open lateNice service and good licuados de fresa

18.description: Tacos al pastor are the best! I ordered take out 2 tortas and 3 tacos, for 3 people. They gave me 4 tiny salsa containers.  When I asked for more, he wanted to charge me 30 cents per container! Ridiculous!! What a joke!! This is the only reason I didn't give them 5 stars.

13.description: I come here for the tacos de asada and strawberry milkshakes. Seriously their milkshakes are great. My sister and I alway order them when we go, and we're not really milkshake type of girls (if thats even a thing). And their carne asada tacos are great.

4.description: LoAll tacos were dry and meat was tasteless .  We ordered asada taco, picadillo taco, avocado tacos. For a place that sells tortillas wholesale you would think  they are good tacos. Not really. Our tortillas were dry and fell apart. Must have been old tortillas.When we arrived, all the available tables were dirty. I had to clean the table myself with the napkins left on the table. Gross. The server was ok. Polite. Food was mediocre.  I will not be returning. Very dissapointing. Weired thing, we saw a waiter pouring the horcharta from a dirty bucket into the dispenser. Kinda gross.

24.description: Umm how have I not written a review for this place yet??I've been coming here for almost ten years now and this is THE place to which I compare all other taco joints.  Atotonilco is absolutely the bestestestestest place to get a carne asado taco anywhere in the city (although my bf does love the al pastor also) and probably the country too!!They give you HUGE tacos overflowing with really really good steak (no hard fatty gristle here) at $2 a taco but the thing that stands out most about these tacos have got to be their tortillas.  What's the big deal about tortillas you ask?  You will never know until you try them here!  Atotonilco makes their own tortillas (and sells them in grocery stores) and what makes them so unique is that they lightly dip them in oil before putting it on the grill so you end up with a slightly crisp (but still soft) greasy tortilla that goes oh so perfectly well with the steak.  Every bite is truly like a little piece of taco heaven.The shakes here are also to die for, especially the strawberry one.  The horchata is a little on the sweet side for some people but thats how I like mine so its always perfect for me :)Oh how I wish I still lived on the southside or that they would open up a location on the northside.  But making the half hour drive is sooooo worth it!

6.description: While I genuinely enjoy the tacos al pastor from Atotonilco's, I do not care for the horrible customer service.  The man at the register (is there often during lunch time) was not friendly and kind of arrogant.  I know they don't take debit cards (I don't know why they wouldn't) so I called to place my order and asked if he could give me a total so that I could see if I had enough cash before going to pick up my order.  He said he couldn't give me a total until he rang me up.  I know they have an ATM in the lobby, but I have been there before only to find it was out of service.  I asked if the ATM was working and he yelled out to a waiter who said he didn't know.  Rather than going out to check to see if it was working, he told me I should just stop by somewhere else to make sure I had enough money.  When I came to pick up my order, he barely addressed me other than to take my money and then did not even thank me.  There is nothing more off putting than poor customer service.  Especially in a neighborhood full of taquerias!  Make yourselves stand out for good food AND good service!  Please, talk to your employees about treating customers well.  A happy customer comes back and recommends the place to others.  Yes, your tacos are alright, but your service is not.

22.description: Tacos de carne asada con cilantro, cebolla, queso, crema= Flame! Dont forget the tastiest carrots ever! Horchata or liquado de fresa to drink. One of the best

15.description: If I can give this place no stars I would. First of all I had 2 hairs in my food. That is soooo disgusting they should be wearing hair nets. Second of all the steak has noooo flavor at all. Very disappointing. Hopefully I don't get food poison from this place.

7.description: Horrible!!!! Just plain awful! It was my first time there and the torta de Carne Asada was tasteless! It had no salt whatsoever the meat was extremely dry and there were ants on the table. Service was horrible, the waitor literally forgot half my order, and they do not accept credit cards! To top it off, their atm doesn't even work! A restaurant should be prepared for everything, especially new customers.Would not recommend.

8.description: Their asada tortas are the worst. Dry meat, dry everything. My torta fell apart at how badly it was put together. Never ordering that item from here.

3.description: I remember this place when it first opened. It used to be clean with great food. I visited today and the food is still great but the inside is disgusting. The floors and the grout have layers of crud from what looks like years of not properly cleaning the floors. Most of the light bulbs are burned out and all the heating and cooling vents have dust bunnies hanging and ready to bounce onto your plate. The walls are filthy and need a good scrubbing. This isn't from a few weeks of neglect, it's from years of neglect. The food may still be good, but if the areas we can see are this filthy, I wonder how bad the walk ins and food storage areas are where we can't see.

14.description: I thought for sure I'd eat a torta, some tacos, a side of cebollitas, and then consider dessert...but, I started with the order of a torta de carne asada as to not scare my family.  It wasn't pretty, but it was tasty.  At the table were tacos of all kinds, tortas, a carne asada plate, agua de tamarindo and horchata.  It was all very tasty and filled us up.  The prices are very reasonable at $4.50 for a torta and $11.50 for a carne asada plate which is a huge portion of meat, rice, beans, half an avocado, grilled serrano peppers, and green onions.  It's not fancy, but it's a good place to get some solid Mexican food.  They have a small parking lot, and be warned everyone in the area seems to drive an oversized SUV, so you might not fit in a space or drive down the street with ease.  Otherwise, definitely worth hitting up.

3.description: In the spirit of being cheap and Weekly tribune coupons,we decided to go to Chuck E.Cheese.We ordered 100 tokens for 15 bucks.We-being 2 adults and 2 kids.We had a nice time,I did not expect the place to be so busy on a Wednesday night.This is not the chuck E. Cheese of my youth.There were no "bucket of balls" to play in nor did they have the old Chuck in costume,instead they had a "video" of Chuck and friends singing the happy birthday song to a group of kids nearby...WTF?..a video?When did that start?I suppose that the big cheese has to cut costs like the rest of us...Good times for cheap indeed.

1.description: My mom threw a party here this past Saturday. Not only were the pizzas over 45 minutes late, but they rushed us out a half hour before our original due time! We reasoned with them that they should let us have an aditional 50 minutes or at least a half hour since they made us wait but they had another party to set up for so they couldn't do it. They didn't even give her a discount for the inconvenience! As nice as the hostess and staff was, we were pissed when we left. Guess who's not going back?!

2.description: been here a couple of times, and we just don't really enjoy ourselves. there are kids all over you when trying to play a game and try to take over. I don't feel that is very clean. my son loves going to chuck e cheese will for sure look for a new location!!
