0.description: Had a party here... it is what it is all kids screaming, crying, laughing, fighting, bulling, you name it it gets done here. good service, ok food and great entertainment for the kiddies. wear their little butts out to get a good night sleep her... Very hot inside through.

3.description: This place needs renovations. It looks like its from the 50's. And no not in a cool good way. It looks like its from the 50's and they've only repaired what needs to be repaired to maintain their license. The staff has no set uniform. They all wear what ever they want like a baggy jeans and a hoody with only name tag. Kinda hard to make out who works there and who is a customer. Bottom line, if you need a little thing or 2 then go for it, but if you are going to do massive shopping, you should probably do it elsewhere. Shop where the business actually cares about their performance and appearance.

1.description: I get a depressing feeling when I walk in here. Just looks dark and dingy.Weird that they put those price stickers on their items like in those corner/pharmacy stores. Price still rang up wrong. Cashier took her time, but was nice and friendly.

2.description: This review is for the Little Cesar's only!  I ordered a pizza and was waited on by an employee named David.  He was so polite and professional......it made my experience so nice.  So not what I expected from a fast food employee.  I sure hope this kid is in a management position!

0.description: They've got an ok selection as far as I can tell. They didn't really have what I was looking for, but it's a standard K-Mart. I like that they have a Little Caesar's in there...if you're hungry, broke and don't have any standards. :P

4.description: The store time forgot, this Kmart has seen better days. The store looks very tired from the cracking and yellowing floors to the old and dingy fixtures. The music section was awful, nothing was in the proper place or genre. The store's products are good, it's just the awful environment will keep me from ever returning.

1.description: *prices are EXTREMELY over priced!On top of that it seems as though the American dollars value fluctuates depending on the day of the week and who rings up your sale.Count your change,count your change,COUNT YOUR CHANGE!!!!!!!!!If by the unfortunate event that you have to actually stop in this sorry excuse for a neighborhood liquor store of convenience,the least of a favor you can do for yourself is use cash! AND COUNT YOUR CHANGE! They charge you a fee if you use a credit card/debit card no matter if you buy a .99c bag of chips or a ridiculously over priced fifth of liquor.The employees also look like sloth from the goonies!*baby Ruth candy bars always fresh though.

0.description: Its an OK place for beer prices can be average sometimes or about a buck above other places. Nothing to go out of your way for. Its just convenient for me.

The best carnitas in the area there are some grocery store that sell carnitas in the area and this place kicks there butt!! And on the weekdays they have pork skins with carne on it it is the best!! But for the carnitas get there early church people Like to flock in after wards!

1.description: TO GO REVIEWWhenever we celebrate a birthday in the office, a coworker brings these in. 12 tamales for $10, not bad right?! We typically get the chicken and the pork (don't let the red color fool you). The chicken ones have the perfect amount of spice to them. They're a decent size too! I hear the lines get crazy long even at 7am, so go early!

9.description: Incredible Tortas made with fresh homemade bread. Order the meat torta amazing. Includes fresh home made sauces. Workers in great mood!

12.description: quesadilla is good!except for the pieces of plastic in lettuce!:/i thought it was a mistake went bck twice again and no there is plastic in lettuce.

21.description: I love Chicago.I was driving south on kedzie this morning, keeping an eye out for some tasty looking grub. what usually grabs my attention is a pig or chicken selling it's demise, but today it was a beautiful picture of a smothered tamale. i'm not sure what that tamale was covered in, but because it looked so good i made a beeline inside. once inside, i knew i hit the jackpot when there was a line 7 people deep. they have all sorts of tamales, including the elusive oaxacan tamale, stripped pepper with cheese, beans and cheese and even savory ones. each tamale I had was the best of it's kind i ever had. the masa is fluffy and moist and just kind of melts in your mouth. it almost had the texture of cake! they also have a variety of alotes (warm sweet fruit drinks) and the guayaba version i had was phenomenal. get here early because when i was there at 10:30, they had sold out of most of their tamales. i would give this restaurant 10 stars if i could.

16.description: Great tamales!  My personal favorite is the chicken in salsa verde.  Prices are fair, and I look forward to buy in bulk for an upcoming party.  If you're on the fence about going, GO.  Tamales is what they advertise and that's what they deliver.

17.description: Went there twice and will never go back! Their tamales are very dry and they have terrible service.1st time, they are very rude and try to rush me to decide what I wanted. I asked them a couple of questions and they replied with an attitude. I thought maybe they were having a hard day and let it pass. 2nd time, same thing happened. I got there right before they close (9) and then a lady was trying to tell them from outside the door she wanted to buy some tamales, and they refused to opened the door. I look at my watch and it's 9:02. I also think it wasn't right for them to talk about the lady in from of the customers that were still inside. I guess they just sell a lot during the day that they don't care if customers don't come back. People around the neighborhood know them for being rude!

10.description: Quite frankly you just need to stop here, this is what your taste buds dream of. Almost as wonderful as mom used to make, and watching the ladies in back brings back memories, they obviously have a huge following, who knew they made pots that big, wow. I had the red and green tamales, the red sauce is delicious with just the right amount of spice.  The green sauce is spicier but you sacrifice a little taste with it but still delicious! , sitting is a challenge as the place is a little disorganized but not a bad thing, adds to the ambience. More of a lunch place but oh so worth it. Later.....

5.description: this place is just ok. the only time ull get juicy, moist tamales is when they first open in the morning and coming right out the pot. other than that, dont count on it. very slow service,  tamales arent that flavorful, too much masa, not enough meat, savw ur money and go to pilsen.

11.description: They used to be good.I used to come here all the time when I wanted tamales. At first they were really good but now their memory is all that is left.Their tamales are huge but it is mostly masa and no filling. And not even the masa is good. It is so spongy and underseasoned.Gotta give it to them, the arroz con leche is still good as well as their guayaba atole.but when it comes to tamales, I drive a little bit more to the next tamaleria.Manolo what happened to your tamales?????

3.description: This place is just ok. After reading all these raving reviews, my expectations where a bit higher. Prices for tamales are standard to other places. Like other reviews, I wish the tamales were spicer. I ordered the cheese and the chicken. I felt that the tamales needed more filling. There was barely any cheese in the tamale, mainly consisting of masa. The tamales were a bit bland and didn't have too much flavor. Will try another place in the future when searching for tamales.

0.description: This place is great!!!!. I had a chicken gordita...it was soft,firm , fresh ,with great fresh old school topping!!!!..PLEASE VISIT!!!!! Great fresh food!!!

20.description: Love all the food here, especially the tortas and their special sauce. Highly recommen.

19.description: Love all the food here, especially the tortas and their special sauce. Highly recommen.

2.description: we have bought these tamales for over 4yrs now, we buy them almost once a week on Fri or Sat mornings, and lately the last 6months roughly, they have really been horrible.. I just purchased 1dozen this morning, and literally, all tamales only have 1 piece of meat! I even have a picture I wish I can post..  I just called to complain and ask If I can return them and get my money back and they said no because I need my receipt. If I would have known this was going to happen I sure would have saved it! Plus I asked if they can check their debit/credit machine since I paid with my debit card and I can show them proof of purchase and they did not accept that.. I also bought half dozen 1 week and a half ago and the tamales were not done yet. when you opened them, all the tamale fell apart because they were all mushy!!! This place was the best and their tamales were always delicious, I don't know whats going on with them now.. unfortunately, they have lost one client here!

18.description: I live in Evanston and I would not go anywhere else for tamales. I was just there this past weekend and got a dozen Oaxaqueno tamales. I have tried all their tamales, but those are my favorites.  They open up very early, so I was there to get tamales by 8:00 AM on a Sunday and thought I may as well get some breakfast too. I ordered the Steak Quesadilla and it was incredibly good. For $4 you get a Quesadilla made in a buritto sized tortilla and a very generous portion of grilled steak  piled inside.  It also comes with a side of sour cream, a side of Guacamole, and lettuce and tomato. I will agree that there is just a bit of a wait for the food, but just have a seat and watch the Mexican Music Videos on the television above the counter. The food is well worth waiting a few minutes.  Just writing about it makes me want to make another stop there this weekend.

13.description: Please come here if you want to be ashamed of something.I remember this place when it first opened up.  I really like supporting local businesses and prefer giving them my money rather than going to any chain.  I've always thought the food here was pretty good and was glad to have another taqueria that's even closer to my house.Until:I walked in, asked for a torta and was told they ran out of the torta bread.Came again, asked for tacos de asada and was told they had no more meat.Visited again and was told they ran out of the burrito tortillas.Saw the lady cook eating her lunch all sloppily at the counter and then proceeded to walk into the back to start cooking without washing her hands.I've frequented other businesses MUCH busier than this place and *they* NEVER run out of ingredients.  I will admit that the food is pretty tasty, the salsa is better than a lot of places, BUT they truly have no excuse for much of the sloppiness and inadequacy plaguing this taqueria.UPDATE: came back for redemption visit (or because I'm a masochist).  It was so nice and refreshing to see that things don't change.  The cook in the back had (and I'm not exaggerating) a volleyball size chunk of round frozen meat that she was trying to defrost and cook at the same time as she was picking it apart with a spatula.  No hair net, no apron, no gloves, and a pair of lovely flip flops.

4.description: This tamales are the bomb, not to mention the oaxaqueños. A great five place avoid tge weekends lines are huge. But the wait its well worth it.

6.description: Haven't been in a year and a half. Prices went up 15 cents to a whole dollar each for a tamale. I would have grabbed a dozen or two if I were on the way home!

15.description: Every year I order tamales from this location and usually I'm very happy. This year was a mess! I ordered both meat and non meat tamales (for my vegetarian guests.)Well as it turns out I was given someone else's order that did not contain any non meat tamales, therefore I had nothing to serve my vegetarian guests. Not to mention I ordered more tamales than the order that I received.  Since they are all mixed up on a aluminum tray you can't tell what is what beforehand. I couldn't do anything about it since it was late on Christmas Eve. I tried calling immediately after the holiday and was told by a woman named Olga (who left me on hold for over 10 min ) that I would have to talk to the owners, whom where not present. I called for 2 weeks about every other day and they were never available. I left my number with the same woman, Olga several times and have yet to receive a call back. I finally gave up! The tamales have changed this year not sure if they were less of quality due to the massive orders and the customer service is horrible therefore will not ever be ordering tamales from here again nor will my friends or family.

7.description: My favorite spot to get tamales in the south side. Personal preference is that they'd be a little spicier. They have an extensive menu as I didn't expect it for a place that specializes in tamales. Prices are within reason and cheaper then most stands.

8.description: Very friendly customer service, no language issues, and the food is average and prices are fair. Even if you're not from around here, you can feel at home here.

14.description: love the tamales freshly made daily very early in the morning!
